Reviews.Title: “Very good, throughout”
Reviews.Author: Chuck K
Reviews.Content: I have traveled on business to this hotel, location many times over the last 12 months. In the 20+ trips I have made, I have had really good experiences with the hotel and it's employees. At the front desk, Eduardo is always friendly, remembers my name and is always asking if there is more he can do for me. In Room Service, Mike is always cheerful and friendly. He is always helpful when I try to select something to eat or drink. I really appreciate that staff invests in recognizing me and making me feel welcome. This is a big part of why I continue to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Rosie is OUTSTANDING!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rob d
Reviews.Content: When I travel to Woodland Hills on business, I only stay at the Hilton. Rosie in the concierge lounge is an outstanding ambassador for the hotel. She is always positive, pleasant and puts a smile on your face.

Reviews.Title: “Rosie the Concierge Made my Stay Special”
Reviews.Author: MrsG7147
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton in Woodland Hills at least once a month off and on for the last 15 years. I usually don't have time to go to the concierge level for appetizers but I did on this trip. Rosie made me feel welcomed and at home. It was a relaxing experience that really started my trip out on the right note. The Hilton made a great choice hiring Rosie for the concierge job. She is a top notch person who works hard and makes the guest feel like they are her only concern. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hote and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: David T
Reviews.Content: Everyone here treats me like family. Rosie up in the concierge lounge does a great job of welcoming and making everyone feel welcomed. This is one of my favorite hotels in the country, and I spend 150 nights a year in hotels, so I get a lot of chances to compare!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Very Good Service and Staff Makes It Like Home”
Reviews.Author: TravelerBob0809
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel frequently - too often from a personal perspective as I'm there every 1 to 2 weeks for days at a time. The hotel is a great business travel destination and the staff there (many whom I have come to know fairly well) are always able to make me feel welcome and do so with exemplary service. Eduardo always is cheerful and exceptionally accommodating and efficient at the front desk. In the evening, Rosie in the executive lounge is also top notch - always willing to meet needs with a smile, pleasant attitude, and engage in a conversation at a level deeper than just the perfunctory. Maurice with the Valet service has my car up well before leaving for business in the morning, actually taking the time to see who's staying that night and anticipating needs. Laura in the lounge in the morning has things ready to go at the crack of dawn, and also knows her regular guests and anticipates their needs as well, always greeting with a smile and warm hello. There are many more although these staff stand out consistently. They make the grueling process of staying away from home far too often a lot more bearable by seeming like an extended family. Great job!!

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca M
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel about 3 nights a week for the past 9 months, and have been very pleased. From the valet crew to the front desk staff to Mike with room service, the staff always offer a smile and go the extra mile when needed to make sure the stay is enjoyable. I haven't used the gym or actual restaurant, but I do get room service every once in a while. The shrimp cesar salad and pear/chicken salads are great. Being right next to Cheesecake Factory is a nice bonus. Happy to give five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Room Service A+++”
Reviews.Author: fongj01
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel and service is awesome. Every time i visit the hotel, the staff treats me very well and the room service provided by Mike is outstanding. Food tastes great and it comes in a timely fashion. Thanks and hope you enjoy this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent visits”
Reviews.Author: jetbob655
Reviews.Content: I stay here once or twice a month and it is always enjoyable. Good location, close to everything. The Executive floor club offers a great reception in the evening. The restaurant has a very good hot breakfast buffet. Room service is very friendly and fast and Mike makes it awesome. I also make good use of the WiFi and the Exercise Room.

Reviews.Title: “Executive King for One”
Reviews.Author: ToriannaLee
Reviews.Content: 1 KING BED EXECUTIVE FLOOR, Non-Smoking, BED AND BREAKFAST, $224 per night. To get to my floor, my room card was needed to gain access. Once I got to my room, I discovered it to be very clean and spacious. I had a television, complimentary beverages, and Wifi was included. I didn't get to explore much of the hotel (such as the pool and such), however I have complimentary intercontinental breakfast in the lounge which only my floor had access to. Once I called for room service, it took a little longer than anticipated.. but other than that, it was perfect for the few nights I stayed there for!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for business”
Reviews.Author: Coug1995
Reviews.Content: I just completed a two night stay at this hotel. In town to meet with a client at the nearby Warner Center Towers, I chose to stay at the Hilton because I am a Diamond member and as such have a few extra perks and benefits that I wouldn't get at another hotel. Overall, my stay was very pleasant. The entire staff is friendly and helpful. As a Diamond my preference is set for a king bed and upon check in the gentleman informed me that he didn't have any king beds available but could upgrade me to a junior suite. I agreed that was fine and didn't think much of it. Later I realized that he must have been talking about there not being any king beds available on the executive floor which is where I was expecting to be placed. As it turns out, I was placed on the 5th floor (this hotel has 15 floors) which is not one of the executive floors. Not a huge deal, the room was spacious but I think I would have preferred a room on one of the executive floors with upgraded amenities. I will definitely be back and will know to ask for next time. Overall the room was nice. It was plenty spacious but there were a few things that could be improved. The heating/cooling system in the room is really loud. I didn't need to use it much since the temperature was consistently comfortable but I imagine that in the summer this might be a bit of an issue, especially when trying to sleep. Another issue is with the hot water in the morning. My first day the water temperature was lukewarm at best. I prefer a hot shower in the morning to help wake me up and I assume because everyone else in the hotel was taking a shower at the same time the water barely made it to tolerable. I imagine this is because it is an older hotel. Additionally the water stream from the shower head is very narrow which makes it even more difficult to enjoy the shower when the water is barely warm. The second day was a bit better but I think this is because I got a later start to my day and not as many people were showering at the same time. The hairdryer in the room is a small travel sized one with no nozzle for air control. That was a huge disappointment and inconvenience that I hope/assume is remedied by having a room on one the executive floors. The wi-fi was reliable and strong and as a Diamond member it was free which was a great bonus. The hotel shuttle is very convenient. As long as you are within three miles they will take you where you need to go. This morning I asked to stop by the Starbucks first and he was more than happy to do it. There are plenty of dining choices nearby. The Cheesecake Factory is right next door which is very convenient. A few blocks down is an El Torito and on the other side is a BJ's Pizza. As a Diamond I had access to the Concierge Lounge on the 14th floor. As "club" lounges go, this one was nothing to write home about. Breakfast was Continental style and the espresso machine wasn't working on the second day. It was free so my expectations were low anyway but I have had better club lounge experiences at Starwood and Intercontinental. Overall, I had a pleasant stay. I will definitely be back and now know for next time to ask for an upgrade to an Executive floor room regardless of available bed size.

Reviews.Title: “First Choice in Hotels in Woodland Hills”
Reviews.Author: Stewartia
Reviews.Content: The Hilton continues to be my first choice in hotels in Woodland Hills. The service is consistently excellent and friendly. Nicole at the front desk is especially kind and helpful and Eduardo greets you with a warm welcome. Laura in the concierge lounge provides superb, efficient, and friendly service. She always has a cheerful and caring greeting in the morning. The housekeeping staff never disappoints. Sylvia (?) provides a spotless room. (She responded right away to my request for a new TV remote.) Even the valet staff is friendly. Every morning during my visit, as I waited outside for my ride to pick me up, I had pleasant and upbeat conversations with the valet staff. Small things do count, add up, and make a difference in the quality of a hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Concierge - Rosie”
Reviews.Author: comment1
Reviews.Content: Would just like to extend our thanks to Rosie. She did an excellent job assisting us with meal options in the executive lounge and was courteous and gracious with our large group. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Amazing Concierge”
Reviews.Author: mitchav8r
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, easy walking distance to many restaurants and has a great workout facility. The concierge is amazing. Rosie will take care you, always has a smile, and welcomes you in. All the staff in the concierge and front desk are great. Excellent hotel, I spend over 40 nights/year here, and won't stay anywhere else when I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Dahulk
Reviews.Content: I would rate the Hilton hotel one of the best hotel I stayed in. Very courteous staff especially Rosi in the concergie lounge who is very courteous and very friendly makes you feel relaxed with efficient service. I have been coming to the Hilton almost every month and it is because of the staff especially Rosi

Reviews.Title: “woodland hills”
Reviews.Author: marko b
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is always a good choice for business. Its close to restaurants and shopping. Rosie in the concierge was absolutley fantastic.She is welcoming and friendly and always remembers my name. I will be returning to this location monthly from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton, Woodland Hills”
Reviews.Author: avilady
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but have come to expect more from a Hilton. Room was adequate, nothing special. Breakfast was nice, but overpriced. Must remember, you are in LA, things will be more.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and outdated!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jacmopony
Reviews.Content: I am an avid Hilton person, and I was so disappointed in this property. The furniture looked worn and from the 70's. The huge turn off was that the room was dirty! There was many hairs left in the bathroom. Multiple on the sink, on the toilet back, and in the shower. I did not want to touch anything after seeing this! I didn't alert the front desk, as I got in late and was leaving early in the morning and did not want to go to the trouble of changing rooms. The breakfast was ok. The oatmeal was good. When I looked at other reviews, it seems that the good reviews were from Gold/Diamond members and the bad reviews were not. Interesting. One positive thing is that the staff were all very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but dated and spotty wireless Internet”
Reviews.Author: MadridClydo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the first time on a business trip. I was a little disappointed. Compared to other Hilton properties like Ladefense in Paris, this one looked dated. The rooms were large and the TV was good. I tried to get my iPad on the Internet and no wireless. I called the front desk, then support, thinking maybe a router was down, and they told me level 2 would call me back. They did at 5:00 AM! They never called back again either. In the morning I needed to Skype, so I again called the front desk and they gave me a room with a strong Internet signal. Finally! Not too happy. My first room with no wireless was 433 (towards the fitness club) and the strong signal was in 413 at the other side. They seemed to know, so if wireless coverage is important, ask and be careful!

Reviews.Title: “Bad luck?”
Reviews.Author: johnhuhlee
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel due to all of the great reviews on Tripadvisor, so I may of had just bad luck with this place. First, the rooms were great. Very clean, nicely decorated with a flat screen TV with lots of HD channels. However, they gave me a room on the 3rd floor which also has a meeting room and my room was located pretty close to it. There was a seminar going on so it was pretty crowded and noisy during the day on the floor. Also, for some reason the walls in my room must have been pretty thin. I can hear my neighbors on both sides and their TV. Normally I would complain, but they weren't being loud and I think it was just cuz of the thin walls. Again, the other reviews stated that noise was not a factor so I think I was just placed in a bad room. Furthermore, there was no ice machine on my floor, so I had to travel to a different level for ice. The front desk did not notify me of this during check in. Second, the parking was an issue. They charge $9.00. It always irks me when a non-airport, non-convention center hotel charges for parking. The structure is located behind the hotel and it's not just a hotel structure. It is used by the surrounding businesses and companies. So, it could get very crowded and it's very compact so sometimes it was very congested. There are in and out privileges but you have to get your ticket validated at the front desk every time you come back and a new ticket is issued. Again, this is something that the front desk did not tell me at check in. Lastly, the reviews about the A/C and the doors are absolutely true. The A/C is very loud but luckily it was a cool day so I hardly had to use it, but watch out during the summers. Also, they have to do something about the doors. You hear hundreds of door slams throughout the day. They really need to install the device where the doors shuts slowly. Another thing. Their gift shop closes at 8PM. 8PM!!!!! I had to go outside the premise to get some incidentals. 8PM is a little early no? Even with my complaints, this is a nice hotel. If I would have been given a room on a different floor and if the front desk properly told me about the above mentioned issues, this could easily be a 4-star review. So, maybe it was just a case of bad luck?

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: SKim323
Reviews.Content: I am one of the "frequent" guests at this hotel and I like it very much. However, I understand that everyone has different reasons why they like a hotel so I will break my review into different sections. Rooms: The size of the rooms is very good. They are kept clean and they "feel" clean. The only downsize is that the closet is pretty small but I don't remember ever thinking of closets as being generous at any hotel. There are a lot of lamps in the room so light is not a concern if you need to work late at night. Concierge Lounge: I like the concierge lounge at this hotel. Rosie, the evening staff, is very friendly and helpful. Sometimes while traveling it is very nice to be able to have a little talk with someone about something besides business. Front Desk: They have always been helpful with my requests. They are quick to remember you if you stay a few times and will go out of their way to accommodate you. Room Service: Food is decent and quick to arrive. Gym: The gym is small but usually empty so there is no fighting for equipment. I wish the gym was a little bigger but it has all the basics. The equipment is clean well maintained. If you have a LA Fitness membership, it is next door. Location: Within a couple of blocks you have restaurants that can cater to different tastes (The Cheesecake Factory, BJ's, Gaucho Grill, Starbucks, etc). Basically, you won't starve. Also, there is Best Buy, Nordstroms, Nordstroms Rack, a mall, and many more stores. Also, within a couple of minutes from the 101 Freeway (except when there is traffic). Engineering/Maintenance: I am very picky about the quality of the rooms when it comes to maintenance. I am happy that they are very prompt to fix whatever I find wrong in the room. No room at any hotel (W, Four Seasons, Marriott, and others) that I have ever stayed at has been perfect in my eyes. However, this hotel ranks pretty well compared to others. TV: One of the features I like best is the in room DVR. TV programming is lacking since they recently changed the line up. I was disappointed to find out the new programming. Internet: The in room internet speed is quite decent and connections are solid. Things I would like fixed: One thing that I always think about is that the room doors need adjusting. They slam quite loudly and they seem to shake my room if my next room's door closes. Also, some type of crowd control would be nice when there are events. Some of the event guests tend to stand in the drive way.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant, Non Descript Hotel”
Reviews.Author: microsciences
Reviews.Content: The Hilton, located at the Warner Center in the San Fernando Valley is a pleasant, clean, hotel, that fades into the background and holds no surprises good or bad. My only comment on the room was the location of the A/C system and the noise it makes each time it starts up - its like standing next to jet engine. Since i spend little time in a room, and only to sleep and clean up,it was not important enough to get a room change The restaurant served a good breakfast and the menu for the lunch and dinner was reasonable should you need to stay in for meals. My major complaint with Hilton, and most other hotels of this class is the charge for access to the internet. Its no longer a perk or special service, but a requirement of life. They do supply the Financial Times and USA Today but that's a legacy solution; I get them both on my phone. Cheap motels in the middle of nowhere can supply it for free, why can't Hilton find a way to do it? Charging for parking ($14.00/ night) also bothers me, but real estate is expensive and space is at a premium. A comment on my part regarding the all the member rewards programs and the like As a frequent traveler, and a Hilton Rewards member I am growing weary of the games played by hotels, airlines, car rental companies et al. to join and receive points for rewards. I think that day is past - I will get my own rewards, thank you; give me your lowest price, make my experience a good one, and remember my preferences when I show up again.... None of this stuff is really free. Travelers, frequent and infrequent need to start demanding a better value and less smoke being blown .

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: SCroz
Reviews.Content: Although I'm a Hilton Diamond, I was impressed with the hotel's service. Because I was on the Executive Floor, I had the pleasure of outstanding service from Rosie (Concierge), who not only provided great service but took the time the time to engage in personal conversation. One of the highlights of a the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best service - Emmanuel S”
Reviews.Author: E S
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here for 7 years, and the service has always been great. Rosie is a formidable hostess in the executive lounge, while the Valet parking guys (Maurice, Mark and Danny) go the extra miles to make sure they play their part in the great service I received. The front desk crew is always eager to help from Nicole, Christina, Arturo. Babbet. thnak for making the food changes in the executive lounge!

Reviews.Title: “How It's Done!”
Reviews.Author: Craigsworld
Reviews.Content: It's hard to give 5 stars. It means the service was great, room exceeded expectations, location was ideal. Well, the Hilton Woodland Hills fits the bill. I arrived very late in LA after a flight cancellation and other delays coming from the East Coast. The front desk team and valet greeted me like a long lost friend. I was upgraded to a luxurious room. The concierge staff, as others have stated, were helpful and very friendly. The next morning I needed to quickly get to a meeting but could not find my car parking ticket for the valet. I had three wonderful young men working quickly and efficiently to find the right car. Oh, and the location is really great - close to malls, not far (but far enough) from the busy 101, and tons of great restaurants within a few thousand yards. This is not my first time at this hotel and it won't be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Lounge - Rosie”
Reviews.Author: kathy_beaver
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity to visit the Concierge Lounge for an evening appetizer and beverage where I met Rosie our concierge lounge host. As I was staying at the hotel for several nights I visited the lounge 2-3 times. Rosie was absolutely wonderful - cheerful, professional, attentive but also knows when to leave you alone. She made sure that I new where everything was and that I was taken care of and comfortable. Just a delightful person. So if you are staying at this hotel and have concierge privilages make sure to stop in as Rosie will make sure you have an enjoyable visit.

Reviews.Title: “Everything the biz traveler needs!”
Reviews.Author: aw15650
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, accomodating staff...Here for 4mo for biz and am totally satisfied. Particularly the convenience of the free shuttle (Maurice and Glen are great!) and the main reason for this review, the evening concierge, Rosie, in the exec lounge. Friendly, sweet, helpful, the whole gamut. Exactly who you'd want to be greeted by after a day's work.

Reviews.Title: “Hostess with the mostess”
Reviews.Author: becky a
Reviews.Content: Wow, talk about service! Rosie in the Consierge room was fantastic. Needed a change of pace so I went into work for a bit. She didn't distract me, just made sure I had food and beverages to keep me sustained. I would go hear again just for the super star treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge lounge”
Reviews.Author: jennifer h
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at his hotel for almost 2 weeks. I was fortunate enough to utilize the executive concierge lounge. Rosie was so great. She always greeted myself and my colleague with a big smile and knew what we wanted to drink after one night. She would even save us a couple of our favorite cookies to take with us back to our room. If you are lucky enough to get Rosie, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ke_jayhawk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 weeks for business and it was great. The service was fantastic and everyone was so nice. The valet were fun to talk to every day and we would chat about football a lot. There are restaurants very close so you can walk if you want and a mall is near also. Everything was paid for so I can't say much for the cost. The one receipt I saw was for breakfast and it did seem quite pricey but the breakfast was very good

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Troy-was-here
Reviews.Content: Comfortable stay with staff who go out of their way to make you feel at home. Room service offered to order in individual items for me that were not on the menu. Great beds, but bathrooms were quite tired. Good location for shopping with two major Westfield Malls within walking distance. The lobby has a very strange, almost unwelcoming empty feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday Party”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: Our organization held our 160 person holiday party at the Hilton and they were great! I stayed the night at the hotel and thought the room was large, clean and quiet. The food at the party and roomservice I ordered after was very good. I'm a vegetarian and was surprised how many options they gave me when I let them know. I highly recommend the HIlton and find it an exceptional value for the area.

Reviews.Title: “NICE STAY”
Reviews.Author: calfair
Reviews.Content: hotel is older, but in great condition. no pool, but close to l.a. fitness. bought a breakfast pkg which was only 10 extra dollars, well worth it, good buffet. within walking distance to westfield mall, just 2 blocks. cheesecake factory and bj's on same block. great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hilton”
Reviews.Author: cpacraig
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night. Great deal in a good Valley location. Two blocks to Topanga Mall, many dining locations in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: SexyRid
Reviews.Content: Extremely rude staff! Ordered room service at approximately $30 per meal and the food was cold. They were not willing to accommodate their error. The manager was on a "break" when I had questions. I grew up in Woodland Hills and came back just to visit for the holiday... I've also stayed here in the past. The Hilton has definitely gone down hill as if management changed hands. I wouldn't recommend staying here... EVER! Try the Marriott or Four Season if you have any taste.

Reviews.Title: “A Neighborhood Gem”
Reviews.Author: cqibaxter
Reviews.Content: We've been coming the the Hilton since we discovered it 16 years ago. We needed a comfortable, relaxing atmosphere with good food to keep us going after attending birthing classes at a local hospital. What we stumbled into was an elegant yet accomodating hotel and restaurant with excellent food and great service. We've since used the hotel to house visiting family members and business associates. We've given special family birthday parties, and we still go for dinner at least once a month, even though our son is now a grown high school student. We still are served by the same wonderful waiter we met all those years ago and the quality of service is still very high. Truly a home away from home, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Happy Hour in LA!”
Reviews.Author: Hershey67
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were regulars here while staying in Woodland Hills. Fantastic prices for house wine and 1/2 price, delicious appetizers which feed you more like a meal! The service was always professional, courteous, and timely. Excellent location and a terrific atmosphere inside.

Reviews.Title: “I really like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: gvldiva
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived all associates were just wonderful. I will break down the review in sections. Hotel Staff - We could tell this staff has had excellent customer service training. They call you by name. They always ask about your stay. Front desk is very efficient and gets you on your way quickly. Very obvious everyone has the customer at the center of their focus. We had a problem with one of the TVs in the suite and within a matter of minutes they were there to repair and apologized that we even had a problem. Rooms - I have seen complaints that the rooms are dated. However I think the rooms are more a provincial style which may not appeal to everyone. For us the rooms were great because the bed was very comfortable, the water was hot, towels were bright white and the rooms were exceptionally clean. I can't ask or more than that. Room Service/Restaurant - Food was very good. The breakfast buffet was good and had a great mixture of cold and hot foods. Food was ever dried out and was constantly being restocked. Location - We were there to visit our son. The hotel was very convient for our visit. For those who like to shop the hotel is surrounded by high end stores, Nordstrom's, Niemen Marcus, etc. for those looking or bargains you will find a Nordstrom Rack, Ross, TJ Maxx, etc. Also great great restaurants near by like Cheesecake Factory. Bottom line - Don't be turned off by the provincial furniture. You are not in your room all day any way. This is a great hotel with great customer service. Be advised you do pay for parking and Internet. Like all other Marriotts, Hyatts, and Westins unless you have a promotional package. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lordganesh
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels that I have stayed in. We stayed in the Executive Suite and I been in stardard rooms at other hotels that were more aesthetic. Everything in the room (except for the TV) was very old and outdated. The desk lamp had to be replaced because the switch was sparking whenever I tried to turn it on, and eventually it stopped working altogether. I felt like I went back to the 1970's or 80's. I would probably never stay at this hotel again. The only reason I did not rate this hotel a terrible was because of the staff. They were very good. Laura from the concierge lounge went out of her way to make our stay more pleasant. The valet Glen was also very good. I just wished the room was actually updated to this century.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!Great staff”
Reviews.Author: morethanword80
Reviews.Content: I spend around 10 nights a year in this hotel and am never less than delighted with the staff, valet parking, front desk, house keeping and restaurant staff are all wonderful. This has been my hotel of choice in the area for several years and shall remain so.

Reviews.Title: “Nice generic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kramerica21
Reviews.Content: Just like every other Hilton. Nothing special about this one. Large comfortable room with nice TV, but TV was in a weird spot. Can't really watch it to go to sleep as it's in the sitting area. Having a balcony was nice, except having the window washers having a long peep in my window in the morning. I didn't appreciate that one bit. Like I said, it's as generic as you can get.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Welcoming, and Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jxl1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton Woodland Hills almost every week since mid-summer of this year (July 2011-ish) and have always had a great experience. The front desk is always welcoming and friendly (Ann and Eduardo are the two I usually see and they are great!). The valet guys are awesome â€“ I do not have all of their names but they are friendly, efficient, welcoming. As a business traveler who spends more time in a hotel than at home, I truly appreciate the atmosphere, the smiles, and the friendliness of your Hilton Woodland Hills team. Last but not least I appreciate Shannon and Matthew help in us making reservations, and establish our group rate at the Hilton. It was seamless, fast, and efficient. They were always responsive and helped make this a smooth process.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: greatstaydayandnight
Reviews.Content: I have been staying that the hotel at least once a month for over 4 years now and truly enjoy the rooms, the staff and the facilities. Eduardo is always there to greet us by name and it truly helps create a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SDPam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in town for a nearby concert on 10/29/11 and spent the night at this hotel. We booked a king corner room at a decent rate. Check in was fast and staff was efficient and courteous. Self-parking on the weekend is $9, and there were plenty of parking spaces available. The 7th floor room was clean, well decorated, and VERY spacious, but the view of a parking garage was a bit disappointing.The bathroom was large, clean except for the bathroom mirror which had toothpaste spots from the previous guest, and the shower had good water pressure. I have two suggestions for this hotel. 1) Do a better job at check-in of explaining how the parking garage works. My husband drove out Sunday morning to get coffee and forgot to take the parking ticket with him, so he had to take a new ticket when he returned. Then the machine wouldnâ€™t take our hotel-stamped ticket after we checked out, and someone had to physically come out to the gate to let us out. 2) Stop charging for internet use. The parking charge and charging for internet would prevent me from staying here again which is a shame because this is a very nice hotel and I enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE this hotel and their staff. AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Lynda H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks for work training and the guest service was absolutely wonderful. Housekeeping was prompt when called, valet always had my car promptly for me. The ladies in the restaurant were pleasant and attentive as were the front desk staff. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and my husband and I have told everyone what a great hotel this is. Can't wait to come back and visit again !

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Gail A
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at this hotel, quarterly, for the past three years, while on business travel. What a pleasure to have consistent, friendly and efficient staff, beginning with the valets and the front desk, with Christina and Eduardo, and their warm welcome back greetings. Laura in the Concierge Lounge is a joy, helping my day get off to a great start with her attentiveness and bright smile. Adel and Rosie always help to end the day on a pleasant note. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. Great location near Warner Center and Topanga Mall, all within walking distance. The main reason I keep returning is because of the exceptional, consistent service - keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: SofaKing
Reviews.Content: We were in town from Michigan for an extended weekend wedding. Can't say I've stayed in too many Hiltons over the years but the whole wedding party ended up staying here so I was curious to see how the hotel was. LOCATION: It's not far from the freeway which is nice for the out of towner to not have to GPS a bazillion different streets. It's also nicely situated next to some good resturants such as the Cheesecake Factory and a brewery called BJ's. BJ's is a nice lodge like atmosphere where I watched some football at. Well worth the effort. Lettuce wraps were quite good but be careful of the spicy mustard. It will get your attention! There's a strip mall across the street but once you get away from the immediate area, the neighborhood seemed to decline a bit travelling down Canoga away from the freeway/Hilton. PARKING: Uses a public structure so I remind you all to bring your ticket to the initial check in because I didn't and was forced to run back to the car just to leave without paying double. It seemed secure and always had an open spot on the weekend. CHECKIN: Painless and with virtually no lineup at 2pm on a Friday. Not bad. Elevators were always quick to respond. ROOMS: The room was modern and updated with a nice view from the 11th floor. Bed was big, cozy and plenty of pillows which I'm always a big fan of. Nice business table however finding outlets to plug in portables was quite difficult and almost seemed intentionally hidden to avoid using their electricity or something! ; ) The one major hiccup though was the AC. It was cold but it certainly made a lot of noise kicking on and would startle us repeatedly in the middle of the night. Not sure if it's a particular issue with room 1122 or just the AC generally speaking. Other than that, the rooms seemed pretty quiet. We liked having the ice and beverage machine outside our door until someone else used it in the middle of the night! LOUD. It would have been nice to have a mini fridge and perhaps they offer it but we were a block of rooms associated with the wedding so maybe they just didn't reserve that type of room. GENERAL DECOR: Lobby is nicely decorated and the hallway floors were heavily carpeted to reduce noise which is nice. RESTURANTS: We didn't partake but they appeared busy. FITNESS AREA: I enjoyed the elipitical with the buit in TV monitor and the free weights were nice. It would have been nice to have some sort of chest/bench machine though. That's seems like a pretty basic ingredient to a work out area. I guess the limited space won't allow for more though so I get it. CONCLUSION: It's a quality hotel and worth the stay. Most places have their little quirks so nothing to worry about here. The price was right and I'd come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: DblDiamond1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times over the past two years while traveling for business. Each time I am greeted by friendly valets and front desk staff. The rooms are always very clean and well serviced, quiet and beds are comfortable. Overall this is one of my favorite Hilton properties mainly due to the staff. They are professional, friendly and helpful. I would like to provide special thanks to Rosie in the exec lounge who goes the extra mile to help you relax at the end of a long day. Also to the morning crew at the the restaurant they all so attentive and helped me start each day with a smile. As an HHonors diamond member I stay at alot of hilton properties and as I said this is one of my favorites. Kudos to the management for employing such a great team of people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: Stuart W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton in Woodland Hills LA from 9/25-10/1/11. During my stay I received exceptional service from the Valet parking staff: Danny, Mark, Maurice, Erwin and it all began with the first valet staffer who greeted us when we checked in on Sunday evening. He set the tone for our stay but I am sorry I did not get his name. However, needless to say they all left a Great impression on me and do an excellent job representing the Hilton brand. We also received excellent service from Laura and Rossy in the Concierge lounge. They always greeted us with smiles and made us feel welcome and were eager to accommodate our request. Last but not least, I would like to acknowledge the service of two people in the Brasserie Restaurant the manager and one of the servers (tall older lady). All of these employees I've mentioned make a positive difference to your company and go the extra mile to turn a good experience into a GREAT experience. Thanks for the great service!!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality Hotel near commercial offices & shopping”
Reviews.Author: XLR8TOR
Reviews.Content: Down to Business Hilton, no frills, with good service, large clean rooms, restaurant and attractive modern furnished lounge with plenty of large screen HD TVs and upper floor for private meetings. For HHonors members, executive lounge on 12th floor. Valet parking and shuttle service within 3 miles of hotel makes it easy to get to surrounding corporate offices and restaurants. Friendly attentive staff. Valet parking is now $19. One block to Farmers office, easily within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Woodland Hills”
Reviews.Author: Robin R
Reviews.Content: Rosie in the Concierge Lounge is great. She makes everyone feel at home. She is so friendly and helpful. I'm away from home a lot, so it's nice to see her smiling face, and someone always so sweet. The valet's here are great and friendly, always helpful. The staff that serves breakfast and the front desk staff have all been great as well. Thanks to all of them, especially Rosie, it's easy to go back week after week.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Slickd23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this Hilton a few times for business and the location is perfect. It is a nice hotel and very clean. The staff is extremely friendly. Housekeeping always gets the room cleaned before I return. The internet connection is good, despite it being an additional charge. Self Parking has a daily cost of $14, just remember to provide your ticket to the front desk so they can validate it and it can be used your entire stay. I will stay here again on my next business trip to Woodland Hills.

Reviews.Title: “family reunion”
Reviews.Author: aida_pad
Reviews.Content: it was sept 0 a wedding day of joan roa and michel ocampo most of the guests were housed in this hotel for 2 nights.. rooms are spacious big beds nice location. the dinner reception was held at their spacious hotel ballroom .for those who love shopping malls are just walking distance.. hilton shuttle service are available at guest convinience. will surely recommend this hotol to my friends

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but plenty of other hotels better!”
Reviews.Author: Annettencalif
Reviews.Content: On checkin, the front desk did not explain parking other than saying, yes you can self park. We ended up paying each time we exited the first day and were charged $8 on top of the $14 a day charge. When we asked the desk how this was supposed to work, they said they should have set us up for self park & they were sorry they could not offer a refund. The hotel has no pool, which is odd. Upon checkout, the front desk lady was not friendly & acted like she didn't care for her job. I don't like giving poor reviews, but when a few negatives add up, I will. There are plenty of other hotels to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience. Will definitely come back.”
Reviews.Author: Travis T
Reviews.Content: Staff was helpful and courteous. Rooms were clean and comfortable. As a gold member I had access to the lounge, on the fourteen floor, and the service was excellent. Thank you, Laura Contreras.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: frank w
Reviews.Content: I spend around 10 nights a year in this hotel and am never less than delighted with the staff, valet parking, front desk, house keeping and restaurant staff are all wonderful. This has been my hotel of choice in the area for several years and shall remain so.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: RMD_HOU
Reviews.Content: I would like to commend two people on the staff that always make my stays a great experience - James in the lounge and Anne at the front desk! James always makes sure that you get great food from the kitchen and keeps the drinks coming. If there are any issues with your stay, Anne is quick to fix them.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Service”
Reviews.Author: DMilas
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the hotel. Laura the Concierg was a trememdous assistance to us and really made the stay even better.

Reviews.Title: “Executive suites nothign special”
Reviews.Author: Squaredog
Reviews.Content: Unlike a lot of the 4* reviews by business people perhaps looking for an upgrade by dropping in the names of staff/their buddies etc i havent encountered any of that. I had great difficulty in understanding what the checkin member of staff was trying to explain about using debit cards. She seemed to be saying i would havetoay up front and couldnt get my money back if i didnt stay for all the days i used in the room... Anyway - later the same person said she had booked a cab and hadnt - generaly thisis a terrible hotel if you want to get into town. It is $70 to the sunset strip by cab. Breakfast was standard with silly embarrassing voucher system to get fed. I waited for ever to be seated and eventually just sat myself down. Constant "is everything ok here" from staff (very annoying) Also $8 for a small bottle of beer is just insulting. Its not that I dont have the money - its just so blatantly over priced. Like a lot of Hilton hotels.

Reviews.Title: “It worked but nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: Travelsal0t1
Reviews.Content: This Hilton was ok but nothing special as a Diamond HHonors guest. I got a regular room no upgrades. When the lounge was open, the breakfast was good with a variety of options and a cappuccino machine. The receptionist was very knowledgeable on traffic suggestions and activities. The room was pretty large with an average view. Mortons, Cheesecake Factory and BJs were within walking distance once the car was parked. It was easy to get to various locations from Santa Monica to Palm Springs during the 405 closure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay here, typical good quality Hilton”
Reviews.Author: FFPointsRGreat
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for one night but everything was very nice. Nice hotel, good breakfast in the restaurant and a Cheesecake Factory right next door.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel because of front desk , her name is chai very nice lady ????”
Reviews.Author: lilysacramento
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel because front desk lady , make us beautiful vacation superior service unforgetable vacation , I hope you can go enjoy with her excpectional service to you and your family my name is leila, i stay 6 night since last month my kids wants to stay there because of her go there have fun say hi , from leila in sacramento superior service with cherry on the top ????? I keep going back to this hotel because of chai , we love you chai ?????

Reviews.Title: “Beware of positive comments”
Reviews.Author: greg075sm
Reviews.Content: I got a good rate with Priceline around 65 dollars. I fly alot due to my business and stay at different hotels, and I thought the rooms were tired, not the standard Hilton I've stayed at throughout the states. After reading all the excellent reviews posted on TA, I expected to receive the same welcome but not so. Walls are very thin that I head the TV from next room and was annoyed whole night. The front desk agent I dealt with early in the am was abrasive when I confronted him with errors. I am wary of the many single contributions that this hotel got for good this and that, but now I am real suspicious if hotel is pumping themselves up! Oh also, whats up with no swimming pool? Your parking is expensive too. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: TexasEd60
Reviews.Content: This landmark Hilton has been around a long time and is located in Warner Center, a great spot that is easy to walk to shopping centers and restaurants. Our room was large, clean and very comfortable. I think the rooms are ready for an update though. The gym is good for a workout. Breakfast buffet was excellent. I have a problem with the hefty ($14) parking fees though. Overall, this is a very good choice

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Restaurant Dining”
Reviews.Author: mgoug
Reviews.Content: I have made the Hilton Woodland Hills part of my monthly travel routine for nearly two years and the hard working morning breakfast staff is one of the highlights. The food is always well stocked, fresh and tasty. Roxana is always welcoming, attentive and friendly and the comfort of her patrons is clearly a high priority. I highly recommend having a breakfast in this location if you are in need of a fast fresh meal to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Executive Floor is Amazing”
Reviews.Author: brianmeert
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 weeks while our house was being remodeled. Here is what I loved about this hotel. 1. Breakfast Buffet. They have an amazing breakfast buffet that includes a variety of foods like eggs/sausage, fruit, cereal, bagels, oatmeal, muffins, drinks, etc. The staff is amazing and people like Laura always started my day off with a friendly hello. 2. Executive Floor Lounge. From 5-9 on Mon-Thur, they serve light snacks and drinks in the lounge on the 14th/15th floor. It was the perfect way to grab a snack and relax for a minute. The hostess, Bridget was always friendly and greeted us with a huge smile and made us feel right at home. 3. Fitness Center. The fitness center is very clean, modern and cold. These are all things I love. Treadmills have Cable TV's and they have a great dumbell set along with ab/yoga area. Downsides 1. Maid Service. I'm not sure why, but the maids never left new soap in our room. We had plenty of shampoo or conditioner, but never any soap. We ended up just buying some from the store. 2. Overpriced Parking. The hotel charges like $10/day for self parking and $15 for valet. Not really a problem except there is street and business parking pretty much everywhere within a 5 mile radius of the hotel. Not a huge deal, it just seemed like a needless charge.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Laura”
Reviews.Author: rosalyn1971
Reviews.Content: Laura at the Concierge Lounge was very helpful and friendly. As soon as you walk into the lounge you are greeted by Laura with her wonderful smile and approachable demeanor. I felt very welcomed as a guest. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: HHtraveller55
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotels many times for business, the staff are very friendly and helpful. A thanks to Christina, Mauricio and Chai for their excellent and efficient services.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ilike2fly
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel. Room and hotel were clean and inviting, Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Especially loved the breakfast service at the restaurant. The waitress, Yethar, provided exactly service. Will definitely stay here again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel provides great customer service on a consistent basis.”
Reviews.Author: thao02
Reviews.Content: Whenever I arrive I am always greeted by Eduardo. Checking in is always easy and fast. Laura who works in the concierge lounge is always friendly. She remembers her hotel guests. Laura always remembers how I like my coffee and she ensures that the creamer I like to use is always available. Eduardo and Laura are both great assets to the Hilton family.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable friendly considerate service”
Reviews.Author: TCW123
Reviews.Content: There are a number of people in this establishment that stand out during my frequent visits to this establishment: -Laura in concierge -James in Fredericks Lounge -Maurice in valet -Nicole at front desk -Francois Khoury General Manager These folks always make me feel welcome and are very accommodating. These folks make my stay enjoyable. Tom Walsh

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: js0en
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff is very helpful. They provided excellent service. The room is nice and comfortable. I really enjoyed staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast with a SMILE”
Reviews.Author: cyclesweetie17
Reviews.Content: I return monthly to the Hilton Woodland Hills. Every morning Laura in the Concierge lounge has a big smile and remembers my breakfast preferences. She remembers and asks about my vacation experience and even my bike fund raiser event. I feel welcome and know my day will start well, no matter how the rest of my travel experience goes.

Reviews.Title: “First Choice in Hotels in Woodland Hills”
Reviews.Author: Stewartia
Reviews.Content: I travel to the Woodland Hills area four or five times a year and often stay for a couple of weeks at one time. The Hilton is my first choice in hotels in Woodland Hills. The rooms are attractive, quiet, clean, and spacious; the restaurant can accomodate any type of health need or diet; the exercise/weight room has a variety of machines that allow me to keep up my exercise routine; and the business center is well-equipped. Additionally, the hotel is conveniently located to malls and restaurants. Most importantly, the Hilton staff (front desk, management, housekeeping, security, and restaurant) is friendly, reliable, and helpful. Front desk staff members are always warm and welcoming. (The comments on Trip Advisor about Eduardo are absolutely true.) Isabel makes a special effort to make sure her guests are comfrotable. Of special note is Dewayne's staff servicing the concierge lounge and restaurant. In the concierge lounge, Laura is cheerful every single morning and knows how to provide her guests with quality service. The staff in the restaurant provides prompt service, excellent food (hot!) and they are cheerful and friendly everyday. (The chef knows how to cook two eggs over medium perfectly.) When I travel to California, my days are sometimes difficult and tiring. It makes a difference to me to return to the Hilton Woodland Hills for quiet accomodations and consistent, friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “service”
Reviews.Author: thomas44224
Reviews.Content: i would like to highly recommend one of your associates Eduardo, i am a diamond member and usually dont take the time to do this, but this guy is a real asset to your company. i travel alot, over 5MM miles on just one airline, probably 10MM total. this guy is very good. i stay at this property usually 4 to 5 times a year foe a week or so. eduardo is very consistent and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations/service!!”
Reviews.Author: 2003Cobra
Reviews.Content: Of special note, Laura (morning Concierge Lounge) is always gracious, helpful, friendly, and very much courteous. She goes out of her way -- extra effort -- to make sure I have a pleasant /enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton - Woodland Hills Exceptional Value”
Reviews.Author: TravelPro33290
Reviews.Content: Since I travel nearly 30 - 40 weeks out of the year it is important to have an economically priced hotel, that is also comfortable and service oriented. The rooms are very nice, beds comfortable, and service staff exceptional. Eduardo has been particularly helpful in providing information, making check-in / check-out adjustments, and making patrons feel valued.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, and enjoyable family stay”
Reviews.Author: masterkik
Reviews.Content: The family stay at the hotel was pleasant and we really enjoyed it, all the staff were very helpful and friendly but would like to especially thank Dewayne and his team who really did make a difference and went out of there way to make the stay comfortable. The room sizes on the executive floor were good, the only negative point I would like to point out would be the hotel does need updating apart from that if you are looking for a friendly hotel stay would recommend it. Location is good if you want to be away from down town, the close by amenities were very good e.g. Cheesecake factory next door to the hotel, the Westfield shopping centre is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place...for the price I paid”
Reviews.Author: CrossMyDesk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here pre-paid through a blind booking service. I got my room at a fabulous rate, well over half off. So, that said, I don't have too much room to complain. The hotel seemed very quiet/empty that night (a Sunday night), which makes sense, considering this hotel is more of a location for business travelers. It also explains why I was able to book such a nice rate, I'm sure. The big downside to this hotel is the ridiculous cost for parking. I had to $15.40 ($14/night plus tax) to park in the parking garage. Ironically, I found out later that I could have parked nearby somewhere else for free and only walked about 1-2 minutes farther than the trek to the parking garage. The front office staff was kind, though the young man who checked me in forgot to remind me that he had to validate my parking stub, which caused a slight annoyance, though nothing horrible. The room itself was nice. The ergonomic office chair and the king size bed were really comfortable. The bathroom, though, looked like it had seen better days. It wasn't dirty, just a bit worn and considering the usual rates at this hotel (and that it's a Hilton), really didn't live up to the standards I would have expected to see. However, as I said... I really can't complain because I didn't pay full price for the room. Overall, this is a great place... but I wouldn't stay there again if I had to pay full price. The extra charges for parking, wi-fi and other incidentals were just crazy. Granted, they are in line with what you would expect from a Hilton... it just seemed a little too elitist for a hotel in the Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to just have a nite out.”
Reviews.Author: HeikoMeiko
Reviews.Content: I live at home with my family, so I don't have the luxury of my own place. I come here one a month, one every other month & just rent a room with a few friends & just have a night out of good times & laughs. They have a great bar, a mall nearby, and tons of local great places to eat. We usually just walk somewhere & come back & have a grt night. The service is super nice. They even allow us to have a late check out.

Reviews.Title: “High marks for Hilton Woodland Hills”
Reviews.Author: WELLSBURG
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate to have the opportunity to stay at the Hilton Woodland Hills during a long-term project. The facility was clean, quiet and conveniently located. The staff were exceptional in all respects. My experience was very positive and I would consider my stay a great value, personally and professionally.

Reviews.Title: “Personal Service at it's Best”
Reviews.Author: bethpascal
Reviews.Content: We have been frequent guests for many years at the Woodland Hills Hilton. The staff, including valet service is superior. They are all warm, welcoming and make you feel like you are the only guest staying at the hotel. A small, cozy lobby gives you a sense of your home away from home. From driving up to the valets who are the first to greet you to the front desk, all staff have welcoming smiles on their faces and are very accomodating. I suggest that if you don't want an overwhelmingly large hotel and want to enjoy your stay in the Valley, you should consider this Hilton Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel... ever”
Reviews.Author: Gottigirl016
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Hotel located on Canoga Ave was the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. Staying at a Hilton used to mean something, now it means you're losing out on a better place to stay. The service at this hotel was so bad that I will never stay at another Hilton Hotel ... again. I made a simple request - split the hotel bill with my sister. I was sharing a room with my sister and asked the hotel staff to split the price of the room and incidentals including parking and breakfast. They refused to split the bill because they said the computer at the hotel was unable to split up small bills such as parking and breakfast. They then proceeded to overcharge both my sister and myself by about $100. When I tried to get the hotel staff to correct the problem every staff member said they didn't originally help me and that they couldn't split the bill. So I'm out of pocket extra money and very aggrevated to have wasted my time at such a lousy establishment. I've had better service in the third world!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You should avoid this hotel if at all possible -- even with $99 rate”
Reviews.Author: texan123Austin
Reviews.Content: This hotel had service on par with what you would see in a bad hotel in a third world country. I would have rather have slept on a park bench and came very close to leaving for home, but did not due to family member intervation. This hotel had a horrible front desk staff and made errors on our bill to the extent that we had to go to the desk three times before we checked out. Our parking ticket was never vailidated and we waited 15 minutes for the parking attendents to open the gate. The parking attendents were very rude.

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk help”
Reviews.Author: HornPHL
Reviews.Content: I checked in at late hours. Your Front desk receptionist (Kristin) was AWESOME. She was patient and courteous to our needs. She helped my collegue with a former bill that was incorrect, changed a room for me (noise) and personally brought the new key to my room. She was friendly and helpful..........She helped make my stay successful. James Mattie Silver Elite 473575624

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust004
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights within a week. Not much to say about this hotel really. Comfortable very large rooms in Hilton corporate style. All a business traveller needs to function on the move - internet access, gym, bar and restaurant if required (did not eat in the restaurant) and very efficient staff. Not much character though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service by Eduardo”
Reviews.Author: sandyimelda
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Woodlandhills Hilton several times while on business. EVerytime Eduardo has been absolutely amazing. He makes it a point to go above and beyond to accomodate me. For my some of my previous stays, I have had my family fly out towards the end of my business trip and Eduardo always make sure to greet them and check in to see if they are okay. The rooms have always been great and I am coming back again mainly because of Eduardo. Thanks again and I look forward to staying here again soon! Sandra Pearce

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: greatstaydayandnight
Reviews.Content: I don't often rate the places where I stay but I wanted to take a moment to thank Edwardo and the staff at the Hilton for another wonderful stay. As you walk into the hotel you are immediately welcomed with warm smiles from the staff which makes you feel at home. Edwardo is always extremely helpful, always happy to help and truly wants to make sure everyone feels welcome. Thanks again for the wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: LT69
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days while in LA area. Hotel is fine - it's a Hilton. Stayed on Executive level so got to use the exec lounge for breakfast and evening snacks. Couple of restaurants very close, and within walking of 2 big malls. Never used the hotel's restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for solo female traveler”
Reviews.Author: Amaryllis2011
Reviews.Content: Great experience during the entire stay of 5 days. Welcome and easy check-in long before official check-in time, very accommodating staff and great communication. Very nice and comfortable room. I felt save the during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Eduardo Is Great”
Reviews.Author: larsonlarson
Reviews.Content: I stay at this Hilton because it is comfortable, clean, and near where I come to work. While this is all great, I really appreciate the friendliness of the staff (especially Eduardo) greet me well each time I arrive. Which is nice after a long trip or when arriving late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: tmfisher1969
Reviews.Content: Eduardo at the front desk always makes my stays more enjoyable. His friendly and outgoing personality, along with prompt and courteous service always makes me glad I selected this hotel. In addition, other staff have been courteous and prompt with any service requests - something I unfortunately rarely say these days. The executive lounge serves a hot breakfast (usually scrambled eggs and bacon or sausage), along with all the usual continental items. The evening reception serves hot snacks, along with great cookies. The rooms are nicely appointed, and I am impressed with the quietness of this hotel. Self parking is $14/day into a commonly-shared parking garage with surrounding businesses. And, of course, the location is outstanding, within walking distance of many restaurants. I always bring my pug here, who enjoys it well and is liked by the staff. I highly recommend this hotel for business and personal trips to the west San Fernando valley!

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: Solo888
Reviews.Content: It's an older property with dated decor, loud air conditioning and thin walls -- the maturbatory cries of ecstasy from the next room were clearly audible every morning (although, in fairness, he was otherwise a good neighbor). I paid up for the package that included a breakfast buffet and evening reception in the concierge lounge -- OK but nothing special. The coffee was sub-par (opted for a close by Starbucks after sampling the fare first day), the evening snacks were standard issue wings, egg rolls and vegetable sticks. Beer and wine were extra $$. The staff was professional though and I'm not sure there are a whole lot of other options in this area. However, for $200/night, it should have been better imho...

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: carenmcourtney
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling anywhere near Woodland Hills, CA, the best place to stay is the Hilton Hotel. From the valet guys (Nelson, Dexter, Danny and Mark) to Eduardo at the front desk who waves to me before my feet even make it into the lobby, the customer service level is extraordinary and like no other. I travel on average 40 weeks every year and have never had a disappointing time at this hotel. It genuinely feels like home away from home every time I stay here.

Reviews.Title: “You have a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mconey
Reviews.Content: I spend about a third of my life in this hotel as I travel back and forth for my company. The service found not be any better. The front desk staff is amazing and super responsive. They have made me as close to as home as possible. Really first class. The staff in the restaurant found not be friendlier. My favorite is Yether. She always has a smile on her face and is looking to make the experience first rate. I usually will only have breakfast here and get my dinner elsewere locally within blocks, (cheesecake factory,pfcahngs, BJs,plenty of Mexican choices, mortons, etc....but the food at the Hilton is fine. I never dread coming here. I know my experience will be a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: KWWEDDD86
Reviews.Content: As a regular business traveler, the Woodland HIlls Hilton offers friendly and welcoming staff that makes it easier being away from home. The front desk and valet staff are professional and make my stays away from home a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: kasilwolf
Reviews.Content: I stay at this Hotel on business about 3-4 times a month. It's always a pleasure to be greeted by Eduardo at the front desk during check in. He is so pleasant and takes very good care of me It's always good to see his smiling face. He makes you feel oh so welcome even after a long day at work. A couple of weeks ago I accidnetly locked my keys in the rental car ( never have done that before) I was stressed aboout it but Maurice from valet took me to work and said her would get my keys out of my car and drop it off at work by noon..and before noon I had my car. He made me laugh about it and made me realize this happens more than I know so I didn't feel so silly. My sincere "thanks" to Eduardo and Maurice you guys rock..I always book my travel in advance so I can be guarnteed a room at the Hilton iinstead of somewhere else. Thank you Hilton for knowing what Customer Service is all about

Reviews.Title: “Eduardo is amazing”
Reviews.Author: foster075
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed in this hotel for a while since i was assigned to a different office location but its always feel good to be back specially when you have a warm welcome from an amazing staff (eduardo).He has an exceptional customer services. Congratulation to the front desk manager for having such a wonderful staff..

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding - Simply Outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: cjackermann
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hilton on several occasions in the last Quarter of 2010. I worked with Lisa Barbagallo at the hotel and she was spectacular. Took care of everything i needed and was very helpful. The whole team was very friendly and accomodating. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: rrlemon
Reviews.Content: Lisa Barbagallo is the reason we stay there. She is the nicest and most considerate account manager I have ever worked with. There are other hotels we could stay at but there aren't other Lisa's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodation, Great Group Sales Director”
Reviews.Author: ChurchillChuck
Reviews.Content: We bought a business in Woodland Hillsand for the last 6 months several of us have stayed extensively at the Woodland Hills Hilton. Lisa Barbagallo-Director of Group Sales has been phenominal. She has made sure that we were comfotable for our numerous visits. I am taking two mini vacations in 2011..based on the service that has been provided at the Woodland Hills Hilton...I will be staying at a Hilton on all of my trips.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TIDhome1
Reviews.Content: I really love staying at the Hilton. It is always sparkling clean and the beds are totally comfy. The support staff at the front desk (edwardo) and the vallet guys (maurice, danny, nelson, bernie and mark) are helpful, kind and cheerful. It's really nice that they remember me by name and do what they can to take of me. It is a welcoming environment and is a nice place to be when away from home. The location is great since there are many good resturants very near. Several of them are within walking distance. After my long days at the office it's nice to just come and crash in my room. Once i get there i know i have no worries. I also am able to get in good workouts while i'm there. The equipment provided is updated and working. They have a varity of equipent to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but noisy A/C”
Reviews.Author: janesanjose
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby, parking is on a high rise structure next to hotel, and they charge separately for the parking ( it varies weekends or weekday). The room and beds were very comfortable, spacious and they felt clean. Bathroom nice. However, the A/C was loud, it sounded like a car starting. If it was not the noise of the A/C sleep would be good and I would be back

Reviews.Title: “This is my go to hotel because of the friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: thao02
Reviews.Content: I look forward to staying at this hotel because Eduardo who works the front desk is always friendly. He remembers his clients and is always in a good mood. I also like the executive lounge since some Hiltons no longer offer that service.

Reviews.Title: “Operational Efficiency"”
Reviews.Author: Brectenwald
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to this Hotel for work for almost a full year. It is convenient to the office, the staff is always friendly and efficient. They work together and always have a warm greeting, as well as interest to make sure we have what we need. It is valuable to have someone like Eduardo and his peers alert to make sure items get handled: Check-in, Room service, Business Center, luggage, opening doors, and Valet parking. The Consistent quality and execution is appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Eduardo is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Bruxzee
Reviews.Content: I often stay at the Hilton Woodland Hills. The Hotel is nice and the service overall is good. Eduardo at the front desk is fantastic. He makes every stay a pleasant "homelike" experience.

Reviews.Title: “Always top-notch”
Reviews.Author: Rateyjane
Reviews.Content: Third stay at this hotel in the last couple of years. Always nice, receptive. Exceptional front desk staff. Rooms clean, fresh. I never hesitate to book this hotel when traveling to the area.

Reviews.Title: “I look forward to seeing the friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mgoug
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides a nice place to stay with easy access to the freeway. The front desk is very professional and I recommend asking for Edwardo. He true professional and his friendly and courteous assistance is the reason I continue to choose this location for my business travel.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest hotel staff are here at the Hilton Woodland Hills”
Reviews.Author: kathy_beaver
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel over 100 nights a year. The evening front desk staff is the best anywhere - friendly yet professional, quick, efficient - they really give it 110%. My favorite front desk person is Eduardo Villanveva - always happy, concerned about the guests, he works so hard to make sure all is taken care of. As a frequent guest it makes a huge difference to me that he makes sure I get a room I like and he even watches out to make sure that I have arrived from the airport late at night - he is absolutely the best and one of the main reasons I continue to stay at the Hilton. The valet staff are wonderful - Danny, Glenn, Maurice, Dexter - they are kind, quick, helpful and gentleman - always opening the car door and carrying the luggage up the steps. Being a frequent guest at this hotel I see the true side of the employees and this is what I know - they are kind, caring, professional, funny - they make me feel special and like I am family.

Reviews.Title: “Near the top for average business traveler”
Reviews.Author: fubar4
Reviews.Content: Checked in late at night and was granted a complimentary suite upgrade even though I hadn't stayed at a Hilton in years. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Rooms were clean, water was hot, water pressure good and free buffet was above average. Parking was $14 per night...I still feel parking charges like this are a ripoff I would stay here again if given the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for family in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Mominmaryland2010
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at this very convenient Hilton location in Canoga Park. It's kind of hidden, but in a key spot. Easy to find and near lots of restaurants and shopping! We stayed close to family nearby and it was great!

Reviews.Title: “The Front Desk Staff is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: kworangecounty
Reviews.Content: THe front desk staff is wonderful, they know me by name and provide the BEST service!

Reviews.Title: “Our room was moldy”
Reviews.Author: HeleneG51
Reviews.Content: I stay at this Hilton twice a year. The room smelled of mold and if I ahd been staying more than one night i would have requested a new room. I had to use my ashtma inhaler several times at night.

Reviews.Title: “Crawling wireless internet speed”
Reviews.Author: laopu
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and we are a little bit underwhelmed. The hotel needs a major renovation. Though the room we stayed has an LCD TV and the view is fine, it is more like a hampton inn rather than a Hilton. Since it is a Hilton, so they charge a fee for interenet access. But the wireless connection is so poor that we constantly had to reconnect and the speed is almost like a dialup. When we switched to the wired internet access, they charged us twice for the same day. The ice machine on 8th floor is broken. We will find a better option next time.

Reviews.Title: “These people do not care about you”
Reviews.Author: UncleRMC
Reviews.Content: We use Priceline regularly and get some pretty nice places to stay, Staybridge Suites in Chatsworth or Embassy Suites Santa Clarita. This time we were sent to the Hilton Woodland Hills. As usual we call the hotel immediately to make our specific reservations for bed selections. This call is made 2 WEEKS before we are to arrive. When I called the Hilton they REFUSED to talk to me. I explained that doing this is recommended by Priceline and that I have done this dozens of times. I requested a room with 2 queen beds. She refused to discuss and told me that I would have to wait until I arrived at the hotel to make these arrangements. We are driving from Oregon to Los Angeles and after getting a late start and hitting traffic in Sacramento and having a 7pm appointment to meet I decide to call again and try to make arrangements so that we can go right to our room and get to our appointment on time. This time, for the first time, I am told that they have NO QUEEN BEDS in the entire hotel. WHAT??? It's me, my wife and teenage daughter and the choice is 2 doubles or a king. OK, I'll pay to upgrade to a suite. What? The sofa is not a sofa bed? Do you think the people on the phone with me would try to be helpful? Boy would you be wrong. No help and no suggestions. Just tough sh!t that's the way it is. When we arrive I explain the situation again. Nothing....just blank stares. I ask for a roll-a-way bed for our teenager and they will check "to see" if any are available. Maybe the person on the phone could have suggested this and made SURE they had one? We read online that a lot of people mentioned a free breakfast and went down in the morning "assuming" that the very small buffet was for guests. Guess again, the crappy breakfast for 3 came to $40!!!!! So we are at check out and I know the manager of this Hilton likes to read and reply on Tripadvisor so as the gentleman at the desk is telling me the total on my bill.....I say, "aren't you going to ask me how my stay was?" Blank stares. This guy could care less. I mention the bed situation, the phone calls, the hassles....but nicely and quietly so as to not have other guests that were checking in hear me.....I was not trying to embarrass anyone. Nothing. Blank stares. So I say, "I saw online that many people did not have to pay $40 for the pretty skimpy breakfast. I was surprised to pay?" He looked at me and said in a monotone, "Not included in your package." No free breakfast. No free internet. No free parking. No pool. No caring employees. Wow, Mr. Manager, write anything you want in response. Tell me how sorry you are for the lousy time I had at your establishment. I know you do not care. Your employees are proof. Not one person I spoke to had any interest in making my 2 day stay at your hotel anything close to a pleasant experience. Talk is cheap. This is the worst review I've ever had to write about any hotel or restaurant. It's one thing when things "just go wrong", but in this case your employees had no interest in me or my family. You are in the hospitality business and showed us NONE. This is also a reflection on Priceline. They should never send anyone to this establishment and I have written to them too.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed with the toothpaste and shaving cream packets!!!!”
Reviews.Author: photomanberlinpa
Reviews.Content: knowing that cost is a factor in your decision to give out the packets instead of tubes and the small shaving cans, it is my belief that the time the staff need to take away from their duties to give out the packets several times during my stay and difficulity in opening the packets is ridulous!!! You are not saving any money!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an LA suburb”
Reviews.Author: moo
Reviews.Content: Stayed Fri/Sat/Sun nights at this hotel for the second part of our trip to LA. We wanted an hotel not too far from the LA buzz but on the quite side. The hotel seemed to tick those boxes, plus it had a great rate on offer if pre-booked in advance. Upgraded to their executive double which gave us free in room wifi, breakfast etc. Unlike previous reviews, I did not have any issues with the hotel's decor. The parking charge, which I assume is because the hotel doesn't own the parking structure, is reduced at weekends. There is a direct link to the hotel. A number of restaurants nearby including cheesecake factory. On the plus side for us was the Westfield shopping mall + other shops nearby as well. I was impressed by the care and attention afforded by the staff of this hotel, particularly the saturday and sunday morning staff serving breakfast. One of the ladies stood out because she made sure she engaged with customers. She even remembered our coffee and juice orders from the previous day. My only complaint was that the double bed seemed to be on the small side. I would definitely stay here again if I needed an hotel in a similar area.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bridgetpianos
Reviews.Content: Staying 12 days on business.This Hotel is a beautiful hotel and very clean.
