You pay for Valet parking but they are so polite friendly and fast .The front desk staff are so helpful directions etc. There is a restaurant but seemed always empty so I had dinner at the many different retaurants close by.In the next block is the cheese factory. The consierge's level has snacks from 5 to 9 and breakfast and has a nice view.The house keeper was very good so everything was great just a little over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Not deserving of Hilton name”
Reviews.Author: LiscomeBay
Reviews.Content: This hotel i does have a great location. Immediately upon entering you feel the understated design and substandard decor, lack of color. Certainly, it could be said the decor is to be of Asian origin, however, whomever designed this lobby and the color selections did not represent the best for the property. I found the property to be outdated in every aspect, from the rooms, the lobby and the restaurant. The lounge did seem to be more updated than any other location within the hotel. The front desk staff were friendly, the bell staff were purely average and not in what one would expect of a Hilton uniform. The price point of the hotel would allow you to expect something more than what you are getting and I would strongly suggest visiting another hotel instead of the Woodland Hills Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Decent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Kiran-ls
Reviews.Content: The hotel was purely a business hotel with no frills- No pool and no extravagant luxuries. Even the restaurant was purely functional. The good thing though was it was reasonably priced and affordable. I would surely recommend this hotel to all business traveler who is looking for value in his accommodation rather than unnecessary luxury and elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with good room service!”
Reviews.Author: letstalktravel
Reviews.Content: I saved 35% by booking on hotwire (orig $125 for Saturday night) We checked in very late but was still able to get our 2 bed room with no hassles. We were on the 10th floor. Beds are very comfortable with 4 pillows on each bed! Room service is till 10:30pm/11:00pm. Rosemary chicken was YUMMY! Toiletries were splendid! I really enjoy my weekend stay here. ONLY DOWNFALL - you have to pay for parking ($7 as a guest) because its a shared parking structure with like 6 other buildings and businesses.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hilton located in a quiet corner of the San Fernando Valley.”
Reviews.Author: Ashley25NorCal
Reviews.Content: Pretty much what one expects from a full-service Hilton. We stayed Easter weekend so it was pretty quiet at this business-travel-oriented hotel. Nice area in the San Fernando Valley yet still reasonably accessible to downtown LA. Only drawback encountered: the room ran out of hot water on Monday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Fun_n_Travelin
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit and understand "Good Customer Service". The Hilton in Woodland Hills, California really impressed me with their positive attitude and respectful treatment of their guests!!! The hotel was clean and the amenities were good, but it is the "Great Attitudes" that have left me with a fantastic memory of my trip there. You can see it is February of 2010 and I still reflect on that hotel staff with a smile and happy thoughts (I stayed there in June of 2009). If you are traveling in the area and get a chance to stay there, then do it!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Woodland Hills - Excellent as ALWAYS!”
Reviews.Author: Stevetraverler
Reviews.Content: As always, my most recent stay at the Hilton Woodland Hills met and exceeded my expectations, from the valet parking staff to the final checkout, the staff and property are first rate!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hilton experience...”
Reviews.Author: noelwhit
Reviews.Content: I stay here at least 3-5 times a month... it is ALWAYS a pleasure in every way. Staff is very courteous and helpful, rooms are neat and clean and even the room service food is tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Very Helpful Staff/Clean, Oversized Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jbttags
Reviews.Content: They offered a great holiday rate, (we stayed on New Years Day). Staff was very helpful at check-in .... upgraded our rooms because of the extended family we had traveling with us. It was within walking distance to nearby restaurants and shops. We were traveling to the Getty the next day, and the hotel was in a great location for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: nhobby
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute reservation to stay on New Years Eve to attend a party. Everything was ready for us when we arrive. Friendly staff greeted us. I would stay there again and plan on it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room.”
Reviews.Author: vegashelen
Reviews.Content: Paying for parking was the only downside. Other than that the room was very nice. The bathroom clean (like it should be). The staff were very friendly. But like I said to pay for parking we did not like.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice ~ Easy Access to The Rose Bowl”
Reviews.Author: OregonKK
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton in Woodland Hills and we were very pleased. We drove in from Fresno to attend the Rose Bowl, Oregon vs. Ohio State. It was easy to find and we chose it for its easy 20 mile straight shot to Pasadena. Very nice accommodations, we had a great king room on the corner with a nice view of the hills and the price per night was really reasonable for the New Year/Rose Bowl time frame. Woodland Hills is a sweet little area just NW of Hollywood and Universal Studios is very close. The Hilton location in Woodland Hills offered great places to eat nearby and a huge shopping center within walking distance. Woodland Hills is clean and feels safe. We will definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “The Valley Works for Me”
Reviews.Author: 49North122West
Reviews.Content: For training, we stayed at this property and I was impressed by the professionalism and cleanliness. I even moved furniture and bedding around to peak underneath! Training was a quick walk even better was my first time ever on the transit system. I took the Orange Line to North Hollywood and went further to Union Station (had lunch at Felipe's) and then off to Santa Monica on the 720 bus. In all my years in S. Cal, I never thought I would be on transit--but I loved it! Better yet was coming back to Canoga and walking 2 minutes to the hotel. If in the Valley, I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Woodland Hills and in the Wester San Fernando Valley”
Reviews.Author: Flyintl
Reviews.Content: I liked my weekend stay at this hotel. The Concierge Floor room was adequate and furnished sufficiently. The staff at the front desk and the restaurant staff are very sincere and nice (weekend breakfast is a buffet with made to order omelettes and waffles) which is a great choice. While this isn't the best hotel I've stayed at, it's a good choice when in the Woodland Hills / Western San Fernando Valley area. The large and upscale shopping mall is just a few minutes drive and there are many resaurants nearby. Yes, you have to pay for parking and learning how to use one parking ticket to get in and out as many times as you want takes a little learning, but the staff are very accommodating in teaching you how. I'm a Hilton HHonors Diamond member (top tier) and the upgrade and free full weekend breakfast were very nicely provided.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASURE TRIP TO SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA”
Reviews.Author: Tavelingpair
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel a lot ! We were away 109 days in 2008. All on pleasure trips. We have been to all 50 states and all providences in Canada from B.C. to Newfoundland. We have been Diamond Members with Hilton Hotels for several years now, for we have found their point program to be superior to other hotel chains. The Woodland Hills Hilton was a great choice. Very updated spacious rooms with shopping and superior restaurants nearby. A great value at the right price. We would return to this hotel again if we were in the area. Their employes were also courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: hempist
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Hilton many times. It's right next door to the Cheesecake Factory and BJ's Brewery which is really convenient. There's also many fast food restaurants and shopping nearby. The people who work at this Hilton are always very friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and they have nice, big, flat screen TV's. Once they had cold water in the lobby with lemons, limes, and oranges floating in it, it was so good but I've never seen it again. I wish they had it every day! One thing you should know about this hotel is that they charge $14 a day for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: daverainh2o
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property many times over the years and it is a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay. What you should expect form a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: glaubscher
Reviews.Content: Was reccomended by my company to stay here and was quite pleased with the hotal and staff. Room Service was prompt and food was hot and tasty

Reviews.Title: “One Happy Customer”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyer20
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton many many times over the past few years and I always look forward to returning. I consider myself hard to impress, but I can always count on being treated as a valued customer and their excellent service is a constant. On top of this, the rooms are great and I very much like the amenities including the gym. I will continue to stay with them and recommend them to my frirends and family. I can say with confidence that even the toughest customers will be very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: RocketRoamer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a few times before and this was the best visit. The staff were great. I was pleased to see that they improved their breakfast they were offering. They had a chef making omletes of every variety and waffles in addition to the full breakfast buffet they have had before. I also was in a pinch they helped me with. I had left behind my computer and they helped me get it back to me without any trouble. I had to use my own shipping account of course, but they boxed it up for me and sent it off. The staff there did a fantastic job and I survived the trip just fine. The staff was very courteous the whole trip and even afterward. The only bad part was that the parking garage elevator wasn't working right, but it is managed by a different company. I think the door sensor was out. Hopefully they get that fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Canoga Park”
Reviews.Author: thutwoez
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice, all my accomodations were as advertised. I definitely would stay here if I traveled to this area again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time in Woodland Hills”
Reviews.Author: Melissa1973
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be very clean and welcoming after a long day of travel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasWaxy
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and in a great place. Within walking distance of restaurants and shopping. Close to the freeway. The room was clean, roomy and the BED was comfortable. That is the most important. Wish the TV had a sleep button, but all in all a good place to stay. Will definitely come and stay againâ€¦the staff was all very nice. The worst thing was the cost of the parkingâ€¦.either self or valetâ€¦very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel...”
Reviews.Author: maluvsart
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that should have been an easy stay due to its location. First, the reservation clerk made no mention that parking was $14 overnight. The parking lot is behind the hotel with no direct connection making it difficult for a handicapped person. The valet area was blocked by parked cars. I had requested a non smoking room with a kingsize bed near the elevator. I was given the LAST room farthest from the elevator wreaking of smoke. They advertise a non smoking hotel. The halls are stuffy and hot. When we complained we were given three keys to "try" different rooms. We played find the room for about a half hour with our luggage in tow and finally we got a fresh room but not near the elevator. No frig and no microwave. The coffee pot barely worked and we found the beds uncomfortable and the pillowcases were rough. It's evident the staff struggles. If you don't care about comfort, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in the San Fernado Valley”
Reviews.Author: David_Marks
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in most of the hotels in the valley and found that the Hilton was the best for allaround service, comfort and price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Cares very much about your stay”
Reviews.Author: 4poster
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel deserves an excellent grade. The parking is easy, check in fast and courteous. Room was comfortable, clean, quiet and well appointed. We had one gripe with the dinner service which was being served in the lounge/bar. After filling out a review, I was immediately contact by the F&B Director of the hotel and she indicated that she would have the problem fixed. That is great customer service. This is an elegant hotel in a great neighborhood which we got for a very reasonable rate. Easy freeway access - but not so close as to be a noise issue. I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: eppie1800
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotels to stay at plus the location is "strategic". If you want the best deal reserve a room ahead of the time because the rates are fluctuating. This hotel is 100% smoking free however they have outside a designated smoking area. Parking is somewhat cumbersome and advise you to use their valet parking services.

Reviews.Title: “So, uh, Where's my Polo Blue Perfume?”
Reviews.Author: lawyergirl07
Reviews.Content: My assistant and I traveled to Woodland Hills for a brief over night trip with a super important meeting in the morning. I booked the Woodland Hills Hilton off of Priceline for 65 dollars a night which wasnt bad for the area. We arrived around 530pm after fighting several hours of traffic. The drive was a very hard to maneuver with a large SUV which made the very pleasant and helpful Valet guy an awesome person to know. The inside lobby was like a desert, hot and stuffy yet empty. The lone receptionist checked us in quickly. When we turned to head for the elevators, my assistant nearly tripped over a garbage can (yes, a trash can...with trash in it even!!) sitting in the middle of the walk way. After further curiousity, we noticed that the garbage can was sitting there catching a drip from somewhere in the ceiling. We made out way down the dark and dreary hallway to our room which was nothing spectacular. Two full sized beds, ugly dirty carpet, a beat up desk and the bathroom resembled the one from the original Psycho. I began to work on some stuff for my meeting and she turned on the television that we believe was purchased from the Smithsonian. A few hours into our stay, I decided to get take-out from the BJs Brewery located directly next door. I stood in front of the elevator for 10 minutes. Nothing. So, I used the little courtesy telephone to call the front desk to inform them that the elevators were not working. The problem: The lady placed me on hold before I was even able to tell her something was wrong. So, I stood there for another 10 minutes waiting on hold and for the elevator, whichever came first. The same issue happened on the way back, though other guests were not nearly as nice about it as I. On the day of check out and my meeting, I had arranged for a wake up call. The call never came and I found myself rushing to get there on time. In the process, I left a bottle of my favorite perfume. Realizing my mistake, I called the hotel directly after my meeting, while i was relatively close to the hotel. The gentleman responsible for the lost and found was rude and told me that nothing had been found. I went through all of my luggage and my assistant went through her's just in case and nothing. Nada. Zip. So, I called back and his exact words were "I dont know what to tell ya." WHAT?! I was angry and called the Hotel Manager who coincidentally had been able to locate my perfume which was not registered into the lost and found. She promised to send it to my home and guess what...I still have yet to receive it!

Reviews.Title: “The service and cleanliness was excellent”
Reviews.Author: bonus21
Reviews.Content: Overall my stay at the Hilton was great. The service and cleanliness was excellent. The friendliness and helpfullness of the staff was much appreciated. The rooms are cozy, and the quality of the bed and pillows made sleeping extremely pleasant. My only complaint would be the breakfast in the morning. Though the service was being excellent, the breakfast qaulity was below average as well as overpriced. Overall my experiance was great. I will be staying at this hotel in the future, just not eating breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasure staying at the hilton”
Reviews.Author: bubbeNewYork
Reviews.Content: purhaps a little more local knowledge with the people at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly and attentive service.”
Reviews.Author: difrance
Reviews.Content: Everyone in this hotel is very friendly and attentive. The valets, the front desk staff, and the restaurant staff all go out of their way to remember their repeat customers' preferences. All are great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: jn_nielson
Reviews.Content: We arrived prior to the check in time, but the staff was able to get us into rooms with no waiting. The original rooms that we requested were not available but they were comperable and still wonderful rooms to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay, but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: milril44
Reviews.Content: Pros: The rooms are large and basic. Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries were nice. Two computers for guest use in the lobby. Valets for parking were plentiful and eager. The hotel restaurant had good breakfast potatoes and OJ. Towels were fluffy and plentiful. Many places to sit in lobby. Located within walking distance to shops, Westfield mall and restaurants. Cons: Twice there was the smell of cigarette smoke from an adjacent room through the bathroom vent, even though we specifically had a room on a non-smoking floor. Had to complain to the front desk twice about it. No safe in the room. They charge $14 for daily self parking and $19 for valet parking! The walls are too thin, noise can be heard from hallway and other rooms. TV volume is either too loud or too soft, no in between.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Hilton Standards”
Reviews.Author: kitzklan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel on a recent visit to CA. We booked it on Hotwire and chose it because of the 3.5 star rating. This is a 3.5 star rated hotel only becuase of the Hilton name. The hotel was clean but there was nothing special about the rooma nd the service left a lot to be desired. The fact that there was no pool on site is also a negative. Parking is very inconvenient and confusing and costs $14 per day if you self park and $19 if you valet park. We self parked and listened to the valet parking people squeal tires each time we walked to our car. Use of the validated parking tickets was not fully explained and very inconvenient. After several trips to the front desk I finally got someone to explain the procedure. Interesting part about customer service is that the words "sorry" or "I apologize" do not seem to be part of their vocabulary. Another downer was the fact that internet is $10 a day. I had to spend 30 minutes on the phone to get it to work and was told by one person at he front desk that it was complimentary before having a tech person come to the room to get it working and then have to pay the $10 per day to use it. Overall a negative experience for a Hilton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “REVIEW: Musty, Dusty and in Need of Complete Renovation - AVOID”
Reviews.Author: Andriegel
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Gold Member- it takes 30 nights a year to maintain that status, so I am very familiar with the Hilton Brands. The Woodland Hills Hilton is one of the biggest disappointments I have experienced from a Hilton property in years. You get much better service, cleanliness and food at a Hilton Garden Inn or even Holiday Inn Express. This hotel is very tired and dingy and the staff is poorly trained with bad attitudes- something is very broken here! I always try to give constructive feedback to properties when they have missed the mark: I phoned and spoke to the Director of Rooms, who said they were due for a rennovation in 2009. She also told me that they would refund the $14 parking fee (self park) and the $10 internet fee. Of course, one week later the charge is still on my account and I have had to chase the refund. Avoid this property- there are many other much better quality hotels in the area at the same price point that would be honored to earn your business.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to the Hilton brand”
Reviews.Author: Robsteray
Reviews.Content: I like Hilton's, but this one is really not up to par of a hotel of this implied caliber. I have been staying here since Nov 2007 to just recently when I decided I had enough and am trying a few more hotels The best service in the entire hotel are the Valets who park your car. The rest of the staff goes about their duties with the enthusiam comperable of preparing to go in for a root canal. This hotel knows they do quite a solid business with the Warner Center nearby. The location provides people who will stay regardless of the lack of service. They have no incentive to improve. The Rooms: Are nice. The bedding is comfortable and nice pillows. I never saw bed bugs indicated in some of the other reviews and I looked for signs of them everytime. I did however have an alleric reaaction to something in the sheets on occasion. Detergent perhaps? The air conditioners need work. I'm not sure how old they were, but I called maintenance often and there is really not much they could do. Housekeeping often turns them off to save energy, which is great, but on sunny days those rooms heat up. Housekeeping: A joke. the only thing consistent in their cleaning is their inconsistency. I wouldn't touch the glassware, I've found everything from lipstick to coffee on/in the mugs. They do well on the towels, but replacing soap/shampoo/etc leaves much to be desired. I don't think the vacum daily. Internet: Well because it's a hilton and a "Little" more up scale they do charge for it. Not a big deal, but the system speed is different everytime I stayed. I'm not sure if that's due to bandwith of the number of hotel guests users or it's just different between the floors. Workout Facility: Nice, better than most. Water dispenser doesn't always work, but thats really about it. Lifetime fitness will let you workout for $15 and is right next door if you're a serious workout seeker. Executive floor: Nothing really special. The rooms are pretty much like the other rooms, they have slighly nicer bathrooms. The lounge provides a continental breakfast and PM snack. Alcohol is only served in the bar, and if you have status you can get drink coupons. Neighborhood: Great Shopping withing 1/2 mile, Starbucks and cheesecake factory very close by makes it a great location. Overall: If you need Hilton points and you can handle a hotel with some issues you know about going in it's fine. If you want more, There is a marriott nearby. If you like hilton, but have more time I'd stay at the Hilton Garden inn in Calabasas or the Homewood Suites in Agoura. More of a drive, but a better experience at a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “i think this hotel gave me bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: caterwauler
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great, to be honest. But I have since discovered a bed bug infestation in my apartment. I have not stayed ANYWHERE else in the past 6 months, other than with family who have confirmed they don't have bed bugs. I called to ask management if they've ever had bed bug infestations and they said they hadn't. Then I read the older review from June about them. Hotels lie, lie, lie! I don't know, you can get bed bugs at any hotel apparently. But let's just say I won't be staying here again. :(...

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: saeColorado
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff could not "find" my reservation. I booked a night at $109 online and they would not honor that price. Instead they wanted to charge $179. When I asked to speak to a manger, both girls at the desk laughed in my face. I ended up staying in a much nicer and friendlier hotel nearby. I have stayed at the Hilton Woodland Hills with my family several times in the past couple of years, but after this experience I will not stay there again and do not recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “boom”
Reviews.Author: traveler7935
Reviews.Content: Incredibly loud heat/air... big boom every time it turned on or off all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: boro_expat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton Woodland Hills for two nights whilst touring California. We used it as a base to visit LA. Hotel check in and reception staff were first class. Very quick and efficient. Good size room. Air conditioning unit was a little noisy. The hotel was generally in a good state of repair. Parking is to the rear of the hotel in a multu-storey car park. It's a few minutes walk, so it's a good idea to drop off any luggage at the hotel before parking. The restaurant always seemed totally empty, so it put us off going in there. In general the hotel was clean, rooms were a good size, staff were efficient and we felt that our stay was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sueysoo
Reviews.Content: The staff was very pleasent and the rooms were very clean.The price per night was great considering it was Labor Day weekend. The Valet staff and housekeeping were very accomedating and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline = Rude Front Desk Reception”
Reviews.Author: sdtraveler33
Reviews.Content: We needed a place a stay following a wedding and since we were making an early AM departure --- we weren't too picky. We heard of a winning priceline bid for this hotel for the same date we were staying and booked the room through priceline at a great rate. Having used priceline before, I am aware that you don't necessarily get your choice of smoking/non-smoking or king/double/single. But, I always believe it is absolutely foolish for a hotel to offer rooms on priceline then treat winning bidders rudely --- which is exactly what this hotel went out of their way to do. First, the hotel must have been vacant. We booked last minute for $55. Everywhere else in LA was considerably more. Our friends booked rooms the traditional way the night before. When we called in advance to ask if we could possibly check in early, Rita (the front desk receptionist) looked up our reservation and said --- come to the hotel and we'll see. By the time we got to the hotel at 1:30pm, some of our friends (who did not book on priceline) had already checked in. Rita told us we had been preassigned to a room and that it would not be ready for an hour or two. While she is telling us this --- other people are checking in with the other front desk receptionist. I told Rita that we have to get ready for a wedding and any room will do --- we are not picky. She said that there are absolutely no rooms available. At this time our friends returned from their rooms and told us the maids have just cleaned the rooms near them. Rita told us that all rooms are preassigned and we were assigned a specific room. I asked her to switch and she said it was impossible. Rita was genuinely going out of her way to be rude to us and sincerely did not want allow us to check-in or wanted to ensure we got a bad room. After expressing shock that they would not allow us a room, but allowed four groups of our friends to check in (and knowing that the hotel is not sold-out) and after Rita continuously telling us there is no way --- I asked to speak to a manager. Rita then spent 5 minutes browsing her computer and 10 minutes in the back room before she returned and said there was a room available. The room we received was not a special room --- on floor 9 (out of 15) right next to the ice machine. It was two double beds --- although we told her we preferred a king --- we were fine and didn't complain. I was shocked that she was holding this room back and didn't offer to us when we asked --- it wasn't an upgraded room. As Rita gave us the keys --- it was as if she had been defeated. She was quick and rude about it. If the Hilton Woodland Hills doesn't want Priceline guests --- they shouldn't put their rooms on Priceline. I didn't care where I stayed. The only thing that Rita's treatment did was to ensure that when I have to pick a particular hotel and book traditionally, I will not return to this hotel. BTW, the thermostat in the room is programmed to restrict the temperature from going below 75 degrees (despite the fact that it was over 100 outside) during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: joyceschiller
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Woodland Hills Hilton many times past 15 years. The quality of service and room accomodations have really deteriorated. On this trip, there was no air conditioning on the Executive Level rooms and hallways. Complimentary breakfast was less than satisfactory, and poorly staffed. The bathroom was not fully cleaned, and the shower and tub were not touched. The room (Executive Level) was in poor condition. Cabinets were stapled together. The couch was torn and worn. Conrad Hilton would be ashamed !

Reviews.Title: “Room Infested by Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Jake35
Reviews.Content: I spend 6 nights at the Hilton Woodland Hills in June 2007 (room 307). The room, hotel, amenities, etc seemed ok. Slightly dingy, but otherwise not bad. After the first night, I noticed a rash on my body that seemed like an alergic reaction to something. It got worse each day. I thought I was either allergic to the soap, shampoo or the laundry detergent used on the sheets or towels, but this had never happened to me before. I bought new soap and shampoo (brands I normally use). The rash was worse in the mornings, and appeared to be be in rows of several inches on various parts of my body (legs, abdomen, back, chest, etc). I started to research what it could be, and all signs seemed to indicated bed bugs. I finally stripped off my sheets and mattress and found a single bed bug (a flat brown bug about the size of a tick) crawling around between the mattress and box spring. I didn't bother looking for more. I immediately called the front desk. They sent a security manager with a camera. He was sympathetic, but neither confirmed nor denied anything. He photographed my rashes, took the bug, and offered me a new room on the executive floor. My main concern was to not track these home with me. They offered to dry clean all of my clothes, which I took them up on. I also asked them to spray down my suitcase with pesticide. As it was getting late on a Fri evening, the best they could do was to produce a can of pesticide, and I sprayed all my bags down myself. Overall, I think the hotel responded reasonably well. They should have offered to pick up the hotel tab, but didn't, and didn't provide any other compensation. I would have protested more, but I was being reimbursed by my company for the trip. The second room was clean of bed bugs, but I kept waking up at night and checking under the covers. While the hotel seems relatively clean, it was a very disapointing stay. I will not return. The Marriott is close by, and I've no had problems like this over there. I travel to Woodland Hills frequently for work.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blkjck5697
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after winning a Priceline bid for $59 a night. We felt we were given the Priceline treatment after my wife and I were assigned a room with two single beds. This was after I explicitly asked the desk clerk to add my wife to the record in case she needed help at the front desk. After going back to the front desk for a change, we were given a 5th floor room with a queen bed. The place was suitable considering I was in the area for a business meeting, and had some social events scheduled nearby. My wife enjoyed the nearby shopping, and there were good restaurants in the area. I would use valet parking, as the parking garage is about a one block walk. The restaurant in the hotel was nothing to write home about. They offered a breakfast buffet for $11 per person, but we passed on it when we looked at the offerings and the fact that no one else was in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: GladeVandrer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night and found the hotel to be kind of old. Room looked old, the lobby and elevators as well. The place looked kind of nice from the outside anyway. The room was clean and the beds were comfy - the most important thing for me anyway. The area was quiet, and not any sights or points of interest nearby. I paid about $100 for the room and found that to be quite okay. Normally this hotel is much more expensive, and I don't think I'd recommend this hotel at $200 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay overall”
Reviews.Author: shanloraine
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay here via Priceline for $53/night (regular rate was about $110 or $120). We also stayed at the Woodland Hills Marriott the same week (see my review also on Tripadvisor). Overall, the Hilton was comfortable. The room is more spacious than the Marriott's. The bed was very comfortable. The Internet costs $10/day for room access, but it might be free in the lobby (which is the same deal at the Marriott). Parking costs about the same as it does at the Marriott ($12?). We ate at the hotel restaurant twice, once on Christmas day and once for breakfast. We were actually staying at the Marriott on Christmas, but their brunch was sold out and we needed a place to eat. The Marriott's concierge recommended some alternatives for eating out on Christmas, but most places were really booked up with reservations and we wouldn't be able to eat until 7 p.m. or later. Then we thought of the Hilton (which the Marriott concierge didn't mention). We made reservations and ended up being about the only diners there on Christmas afternoon. The food was good. Prices were about $15-28 per plate. For breakfast you can order from the menu or get the buffet for $10. The buffet has standard fruit, pastries, muffins, yogurt, bacon, eggs, etc. The Marriott's breakfast buffet offers an omelet bar, which I don't care about, but my in-laws wouldn't eat breakfast with us at the Hilton because it doesn't offer the same option. I got vanilla custard french toast for $8, and it was very good and filling. Drinks are included in the buffet price, but are extra if you order from the menu. I liked the Marriott's lobby better than the Hilton's, and the Marriott's elevators were more reliable (and there were more of them). I did not use the fitness equipment (which is inside LA Fitness next door) or the outdoor lap pool, because we still had family staying at the Marriott and preferred to swim in their heated indoor pool and use their exercise equipment. We did eat at the Cheesecake Factory next door. It's super busy, all the time, but the Godiva chocolate cheesecake is worth every penny. Overall the Hilton was a fine stay for what we paid, and served our purposes well. In general, I'm glad we spent more of our week at the Marriott, but either place is comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: tindc
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this Hilton. The rooms were very nice, staff was friendly and helpful and overall everything went great. I had friends staying in other hotels and their stays were not as pleasant as mine! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room...”
Reviews.Author: dcdude
Reviews.Content: I'm giving the Hilton-Woodland Hills an "above average" rating based upon the room that we were given. I had requested, at check-in, a quiet room...and my wife and I were pleased with the corner room that we received on a high floor. The room was HUGE. The furnishings and bed were above average. We stayed two nights. Had breakfast in the hotel restaurant the first morning -- it was only 'fair,' so we didn't eat there the 2nd morning. Parking was easy...and the staff was nice. Again, I'm giving the "above average" rating based upon the room and service...not the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: shepdec
Reviews.Content: A while back, I received a "Fast Track" offer from Hilton Honors. The deal was that if I did six stays in a specified amount of time, I would get upgraded to a Hilton Honors Gold card. I had been a gold card holder a few years back, then after 9-11 my business travel got cut back a bit, so I slipped down to silver. I always missed my gold card, because it includes free room upgrades when available, and access to the VIP lounge. So, my wife and I set out to do six local stays. One of the hotels we chose was the Hilton Woodland Hills & Towers. Of all the hotels we tried, this was our favorite, and we made a mental note to return again. This weekend, our daughter went to go stay with Grandma, and we decided to go back to the Hilton at Woodland Hills. I don't know what happened in the few months between now and our last stay, but things really seem to have gone downhill in terms of customer service at this property. It started from the moment we pulled up. The valet parking was jammed with cars, and nobody seemed to be doing very much about it. When I was able to pull up closer to the hotel, I unloaded my own luggage. A Valet finally walked by, and asked me if I needed anything. It told him that I would like for someone to park my car. He asked if I was checking in. Apparently, pulling up to a hotel and unloading suitcases isnâ€™t a clear enough indicator. When I explained that I was indeed checking in, he informed me that we would be charged $14.00 per day for the parking. We went inside the door to the front desk. He told us we had a king room in the towers. We went up to the 14th floor. The elevator opened across from an impressive double-door, with big gold lettering at the top that said â€œConcierge Loungeâ€�. In Hilton speak, this means a nice lounge with free drinks and snacks for the towers guests. The last time we stayed at this property, we weren't yet even gold card members and we received an oversized room with a living room and separate bedroom. We hadnâ€™t reserved a suite, so I thought that perhaps all the rooms at this property were like that. This time we had a room that wasn't any larger or nicer than an average Best Western. We were disappointed, but in fairness, the upgrades are based on availability. At least we were on the towers level and knew where to find the Concierge Lounge. We unpacked, and I set up my laptop. I connected it to the RJ14 cable provided in the room for Internet service. It didn't work. I traced the cable to behind the TV. It was connected. Then I pulled out my own cable and connected that, and it worked fine. Later, I found another cable back behind the TV that wasn't connected to anything, which is probably used when someone complains that the Internet doesn't work, instead of just fixing the cable that is connected at the desk. Next, we decided to check out the Concierge lounge. We went to the huge double doors by the elevator, and our key didn't work. There are two towers levels, so I thought maybe they had closed the one on our floor, so we went up one floor and tried that one. Still nothing. We went back to the room and called the front desk. I was informed that they no longer had a towers lounge. I asked the clerk exactly what benefit we had received by being on the Towers level. He replied, "A better view". The name Woodland Hills sounds like it might be a scenic place, but it's really not. The view was of some office buildings across the street. I told him that the last time we came, we had received a much larger room. He informed me that this was the best room they had available. I told him that I was very disappointed, and had selected this hotel based on our last experience, and so far it was like a different universe. He told me there was nothing he could do except to offer us free breakfast coupons. Then I remembered, that we had paid a higher rate to get breakfast included, and they had failed to give them to us when we checked in. I thought perhaps he would offer to knock down our rate, but it was apparent that he could care less that we were unhappy. We considered just checking out and going home. But, instead thought we would try to make the best of it. Perhaps going down to the hotel bar and having a few drinks would put a different spin on the situation. We passed by the front desk, and I asked for my free breakfast coupons. The clerk handed them over. The bar was totally empty, and we could see the bartender talking to what looked like other hotel employees. We sat down at a table near the bar. There was no acknowledgement that we had even come in. They all just kept talking. I began to wonder if the bar was closed. Finally the bartender came up and asked if we would like something. My wife ordered wine. I ordered a Tom Collins. He asked what kind of gin. I said, "what do you have". He cocked his head toward the bar. I smiled and said, "Oh, you've got a lot of 'em". He snapped back, "No, all those bottles and the mirrors behind them are just an optical illusion". I wasn't sure if he was trying to be funny, or was just rude. I told him to surprise me. He came back a while later with the drinks and a bill. No offer to run a tab. We sat and drank our drinks, and nobody ever came back to ask if we wanted another drink. I finally just signed the ticket and we walked out. We spent the rest of the night in the room, which was clean and nicely decorated. The Television had a good selection of current movies, and the Internet worked after I wired in my own cable. We ordered some desert from room service, which was good and came in a reasonable amount of time. For having been told that all the other rooms were taken, it was interesting that we never really saw anybody else on our floor. In the morning, we went to have our free breakfast. When we arrived we were seated in a corner, in a small table jammed in with strangers on all sides. It was odd, because other than this one corner the restaurant was empty. I've noticed a trend lately where they try to get you to take the breakfast buffet. I prefer to order off the menu, figuring that if I wanted to get my own food, I'd do that at home for free. The waitress made a last ditch attempt to get us to take the buffet by informing us that with the free breakfast coupon, we were limited to only $9.00 each off the menu. It didn't say that on the coupon, and most things on the menu were $9.00 or more. We ordered off the menu anyway. When we returned to the room, I tried the video check-out. After telling me to wait several minutes, it notified me that it wasn't working and I should try again later. We went down to the front desk to check out. It was the same guy who checked us in, and took my phone call the afternoon before. He asked if we enjoyed our stay. I indicated that it could have been better. He didn't ask why, or what was wrong, and didn't seem to care. We went outside to the valet parking area, and stood for a long time with our luggage and nobody came up to take the ticket. I walked down the way a bit and found three of the valet parkers standing around just talking to each other. I stood there and they didn't even look at me. I finally held up the ticket and one of them took it, and went and got the car. I walked around the back with my luggage, and he got out without opening the back. So, I walked around to hit the button and he said, "Oh, it isn't open?". So, from start to finish, the visit was below expectations. Don't get me wrong; the hotel is clean and comfortable. I just think that the staff people we were exposed to had a poor attitude, and seemed to be doing as little as possible to get through their shift. This property, in two stays went from a place I definitely wanted to go back to, to a place I never want to go back to. In Southern California, we have so many choices of places to go and relax, that there is just no reason to pick a place that doesn't appear to want to work to earn the business. The hotel isn't located near any sort of attraction; so really, they have to make it up in service. At that, they failed miserably.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Riversider Raymond
Reviews.Content: Top notch staff. Every member I had contact with was sincerely friendly and proactive. Decor was fresh and pleasant, both in the public areas and in my sleeping room. Housekeeping was outstanding. My bathroom sparkled from top to bottom. The bedding was of the modern, upgraded style (down duvet, 6 down pillows, no floral patterns). As mentioned in other reviews, the hotel has an arrangement with the LA Fitness Club next door. I found this to be a great plus. Hotel gyms are usually very limited. Free access to a large, two-story gym was awesome! Once I figured out the parking structure situation, it was OK. The office buildings, restaurants, gym, and this hotel share the structure, and, yes, it is poorly run. The paper tickets are magnetically activated by the hotel, and are supposed to work when inserted into the machine at the parking exit. I had to have it redone 3 times - only once did it work. However, when it didn't work, I pushed the call button, and an attendant raised the gate for me. I did not have to return to the hotel. On the plus side, there was always ample parking. Yes, the daily parking charge is still $12, but this is an urban location, so that is to be expected. I can't wait to return to this hotel. It was a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hilton but a bit musty!”
Reviews.Author: namenotinuse
Reviews.Content: Location isn't bad: near a couple of strip malls and two or three average-to-good restaurants (Gaucho Grill across the road was probably the best that I tried) within walking distance. The hotel itself had a musty smell in the lobby and in elevators but the rooms themselves were up to the usual Hilton standard. I love the fact that they deliver the LA Times in the morning (USA Today really doesn't cut it for me, I'm afraid). Nice little feature I noticed: the clock radio is designed for the Hilton chain and is extremely easy to configure & use. Sounds stupid, I know, but how many times have you not bothered setting an alarm on the clock radio because a) the clock was wrong; b) you didn't have time to figure out the controls or c) you didn't want to be searching for the snooze in the morning. Restaurant was quiet, the service was prompt and the food was good. Breakfast service was efficient with very friendly staff. If you want to park your own car (instead of using the valet service) I think it could be made clearer what you need to do. i.e. where you should park and the fact that you need your ticket stamped for the duration of your stay etc...

Reviews.Title: “Ok for business traveler, not so great for families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've valued the opinions on TripAdvisor for a couple of years now, so I made a major mistake by not consulting here first before I made reservations at Hilton Woodland Hills. My second mistake was to use Hotwire, which does not allow you to easily verify what hotel you are staying at before you commit, and then once you do, you can't cancel or get a refund. After making the reservations, I consulted TripAdvisor to read some sobering reviews of this hotel, and they turned out to be pretty accurate. Too bad I couldn't cancel out. I had high hopes for this hotel because of Hilton's reputation. I had stayed at the Hilton near the Burbank Airport and had a great suite and great meals at that hotel's restaurant - one of the excellent Daily Grill franchises. For some strange reason, I thought that the Hilton in Woodland Hills would be comparable. No such luck! First thing, as another TripAdvisor member said, there's the nasty $10-$12 daily hotel parking fee (can't remember the exact amount). With that factored in, I didn't save all that much by using Hotwire. The rooms were not particularly outstanding, and not what I would expect from a four-star hotel. Next complaint -- my grade-school children are really fanatics about swimming, so a nice pool was really a requirement. When we asked where the hotel pool was, I was shocked to learn that there wasn't a hotel pool. But all was not lost -- turns out they have a courtesy arrangement with the fitness center next door, and the hotel front desk gave us a pile of towels and a pass. Our kids were amused by all the sweaty bodies as we filed through the fitness center on our way to the lap pool. We had a plesant enough time, considering that the pool is shaded on all sides by the parking garage and hotel. We had to make room for a water aerobics class in the pool, so that was our cue to leave. All in all, the kids had fun at the pool, so I can't say it was an entire failure. But certainly not convenient to check in at the hotel's front desk every time you want to take a swim. We ate breakfast in the hotel's cafe. It was expensive, and nothing special. There is a Cheesecake Factory literally outside the front entrance, and around the corner is a BJ's Brewhouse. I've been wanting to go to a BJs near where we live, so I was very happy to find one right next door to the hotel. Not only did they have fresh-brewed beer and grilled salmon for me, but they also had a great kids menu. My wife was also able to find something she liked, so I felt vindicated for my mistake of chosing this hotel in the first place. My advice in closing -- check here at TripAdvisor before you book any trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room but disliked the parking situation”
Reviews.Author: MGreene16
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights while in the LA area. The lobby was pleasant, the desk clerks very friendly, and our room was on a higher floor with a great view. It looked recently renovated and was very nicely decorated and quite comfortable. We did not use the pool since it was really the health club pool and was in the shade during the times we would have gone there. The parking situation was not favorable; if you didn't use valet parking, it was about a two block walk to the garage elevators. Considering the situation, it seemed overpriced at $12/day. We also had trouble exiting the garage since it was not explained that we had to het a new ticked stampled every time we went in and out. Everytime we returned to the hotel the staff greeted us with, "welcome back!" We stayed here since we are Hilton Honors members and got a good price, but it really wasn't near anywhere we were going. We did find a very nice bagel place nearby on Ventura called "Western Bagels" though.

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the front desk clerk and the bell boy was very friendly. We had three problems with the hotel. First problem, there was no swimming pool, it was shared with the fitness center next door. The pool was a lap pool and it was very crowded with club members and we didn't have enough room to swim. Second problem, we waited over 40 minutes to have extra towels brought to our room, I had to call front desk twice to remind them about the towels. We used the towels that was there originally when we went swimming, because the fitness center did not provide towels for hotel guest. Third problem, we had to pay for parking and it was $12 dollars a day. I think hotel guest should not pay for parking fees the hotel should pay for parking fees. This is the first time we stayed at a hotel and paid for parking. If the hotel get their own pool and parking is free, I will come back, but for now I will stay else where.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and Worn-Out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline ($52 + tax). The thermostat in the first room wouldn't go below 80 degrees. After an hour in that sauna, we moved to another room where the thermostat wouldn't go below 78 degrees. My wife cracked the code. You had to take the cover off the thermostat to discover the directions on lowering the temperature. The decor is 1980's Art Nouveau. Really bad and terribly dated. Ugliest bedspreads ever. Wierd little convenience store in the lobby that sells very little that you would actually want to buy (food/water/etc.). There's a Cheesecake Factory next door, if you're into chain restaurants. Wouldn't stay there again. This pllace needs a major infusion of money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: edwhite78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October of 2004 for three nights. We reserved the hotel through Hotwire and thus received a very good price on the room. The hotel itself has nice facilities. The rooms are clean and modern with wonderful massaging showerheads and comfy pillowtop mattresses. The staff was helpful and friendly - we had a small maintenance issue during our stay and it was remedied in a very quick and friendly manner. The parking for the hotel is in an adjacent parking structure - it is not cheap at $13 per day, but it is reasonably convenient and secure. There are also quite a few restaurants (cheesecake factory, sports bar/brewery) and shopping locations (mall, fry's electronics, etc.) nearby. The only small complaint that we had about the hotel is that the cleaning staff was occasionaly loud. Our room was near the service area on the floor, so we could sometimes hear them talking (loudly) to one another in the hallway. Otherwise, it was a nice place with friendly service, a good location, and a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Hotwire weekend rate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I were visiting family in Santa Monica and decided to check out some Hotwire deals. Their package price for this location on a weekend was $270 for two nights, PLUS a mid size rental from Hertz. Taxes, etc. included. The hotel was about 20 minutes from where we wanted to be, which for LA is nothing. Very clean, very quiet, top quality. Busy place for weekends with receptions, lots going on in the lounge. Breakfast was ok, even if it was served slow, but with top quality service and caring staff. Cheesecake factory is next door, which is where we ate dinner or went for desert. I was expecting it to be a "dead" location in an office complex but it obviously draws a lot of locals and is pretty lively. Honestly, if you are staying in the area I don't know how you can do any better for LA/Valley prices at this quality level. They put us on the 12th floor, great views, absolutely no complaints what so ever. You could do so much worse and pay so much more any where else in LA, Hollywood, and the Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Executivetravel
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, except the reception staff, very rude and dont seem to care unless you are booking a suite or are a pilot checking in. The hotel is in a great location from shopping , surprising as that seems, its close to malls and other places, The rooms are good, although took all day to service. Not really family hotel, but good for business.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for typical Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night for a business trip. Paid $180 for two full beds. The location worked well and I liked that it was next door to a Cheesecake Factory and had complimentary access to LA Fitness, also next door. The room was a typical one for Hilton. Comfortable w/ a nice view of the mountains. The loud noise of doors slamming shut was a nuisance, but not uncommon at a hotel like this. A decent hotel w/ courteous staff. By the way, hotel self-parking is about $8.

Reviews.Title: “Staff could be better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my family here for one Saturday night. I booked a towers room and we were put on the 12th floor (12, 14, 15th floors are tower rooms). However, they never told me that the towers lounge is not open on the weekends (what's the use of the extra costs?) The room was in great good shape. Furniture, bedding and bathroom were all nice. The pool is a joke. The hotel has an agreement to use the LA Fitness pool next door. You have to get a pass at the front desk and then sign-in at the club. I asked for towels and they said you had to get them at the hotel. Went to the front desk again and they said you had to get them from your room! It would have been nice for them to tell you this when you get the passes. The pool is a lap pool and has a very small deck area. We had mixed staff help. Some were very helpful but others didn't seem to care about you. I would stay here again and give them another chance.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Woodland Hills
HotelInfo.Address: 6360 Canoga Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 91367
